name: 2 Witches Winery and Brewing Co
description: New farm winery located in Danville, Virginia along the Dan River.  Tastings and retail sales starting in mid-July 2014. Wine varieties include Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Traminette, Muscat Blanc, Sangria and Strawberry.  Outdoor seating, limited food, and entertainment available.  Check our website for additional information on events.

name: 50 West Vineyards
description: 50 West Vineyards is a farm vineyard located on Route 50 in Middleburg, Virginia. It was named after the historic Route 50, which spans the entire width of the United States – from Ocean City, Maryland, to Sacramento, California. The tasting room is a converted horse stable that sits high on a bluff offering stunning views of the Bull Run Mountain range. 50 West is rich with history, from being located in Civil War battle area to being an old horse farm. We aim to share that history with you every time you visit.50 West Vineyards is proud to produce authentic, 100% Virginia wine. From growing grapes among five properties in Northern Virginia and the Shenandoah Valley, and hand-tending over 80,000 vines, 50 West strives to take great care in producing classic Bordeaux style red and white wines. Three grape varietals are grown onsite at 50 West including Cabernet Sauvignon, Albariño, and Sauvignon Blanc. 50 West combines old world winemaking techniques in a modern state of the art solar powered wine facility located at our sister winery, Sunset Hills Vineyard, and managed by Corry Craighill, winemaker and vineyard manager.

name: 612 Vineyard
description: 612 Vineyard welcomes you to unwind, sit back, savor enticing wine and enjoy our relaxing views at our petit vineyard nestled up against the northwest side of the Blue Ridge Mountains in beautiful Clarke County, Virginia.Delight on our wondrous enticing wines – from a lightly sweet Rose to a dry velvety Chambourcin, along with everything in between.Lisa Adams, Owner and Founder, fell in love with Northern Virginia and the Blue Ridge Mountains when relocating to Clarke County in 1996. Her passion for the importance of family and friends gathering together inspired the establishment of 612 Vineyard.Lisa shares her homestead as a place to congregate and relish with family and friends. She warmly invites you to 612 Vineyard to unwind your attitude as you embrace the mountainous views and surrounding farmlands. Leave your stresses behind and escape from the hustle and bustle of your everyday life. Relax with friends and family, reconnecting your kindred spirits, while enjoying our variety of wines the earth creates. It is a reminder of the good things the earth can give us.Feel at home in our tasting areas that are cozy and cool in the summer, and toasty in the winter with two fireplaces. Stroll onto our 75 ft. long scenic view porch, tasting room or take a seat under our shaded umbrella in the summer or near the fire pits in cooler weather. Be entertained with an array of music on our small covered stage.Before heading back home, visit the vast array of wine related items and featured works of various independent artists in our gift shop. Don’t forget to pick-up a bottle of our enticing wine to enjoy once you return home.

name: 868 Estate Vineyards
description: 868 Estate Vineyards is Northern Virginia’s unique destination vineyard, blending a spectacular location with outstanding wines and elegant dining.We invite you to join us in the tasting room to sample our award-winning wines and talk with our winemaker and staff about our philosophy of making good wine and pairing it with good food. Enjoy a gourmet meal at our onsite restaurant, Grandale Vintner's Table, or eat out in the pavilion at The Grill at 868.In our Tasting Room , we feature The Elevated Tasting, five sweet and savory bites from our gourmet restaurant, as well as made to order pizzas and lunch specials on weekends, to enhance your wine tasting experience!

name: 8 Chains North Winery
description: 8 Chains North Winery, located in Waterford, Va., showcases handcrafted wines. Our philosophy is that great wines are made in the vineyard, and this careful attention to viticulture is evident in Old-World-yle wines that are complex and well-balanced.

name: Abingdon Vineyard Winery
description: Our vineyard and winery are part of 50 acres along the S. Holston River. We have 14 acres of vines with 8,500 plants. Enjoy beautiful grounds along the rustic  river  atmoshpere and friendly surroundings.Please Note that the googlemap marker is incorrect and we seem not to be able to change it after numerous tries. Take exit 19 from I-81 onto US58 east towards Damascus.  Go 5 miles to route 722 [Osceola Rd] and turn right. Proceed 2.4 miles along the yellow stripped road, turn right into our driveway just after a clockwise, hairpin turn.Also, goto www.vinoshipper.com to ship to more states than listed here.

name: Afton Mountain Vineyards
description: Afton Mountain Vineyards is one of Virginia's first farm wineries with our oldest vines dating from the late 1970's.  Our focus is on making wines of exceptional quality from our own estate-grown grapes. Our Tasting House is surrounded by vineyards, 360 degree mountain views and sits beside a 13 acre lake.  We grow 11 varieties on 25 acres. "Grapes don't grow in ugly places"® Come see for yourself!

name: Albemarle CiderWorks
description: Albemarle CiderWorks tasting room offers a rotating menu of samples of our premium craft ciders.  Our hours of operation are 11 AM to 5 PM, Wednesday through Sunday, with live music every weekend afternoon.  July through December 2016 we will be open Monday through Sunday, 11-5.  Our orchard fruit is available next door to the tasting room in season, and our catalog of nursery trees for sale is available November through March on our website.

name: Altillo Vineyards
description: Formerly Altavista Vineyards, we are a small family-run vineyard and winery, an easy 30 minute drive South from Lynchburg VA, 6.5 miles off of US HWY 29. We specialize in limited production of finely crafted wines. Our vineyard currently produces shiraz, chardonnay, viognier, merlot, cabernet franc, and cabernet sauvignon.  We supplement our own production by purchases of a small amount of high quality grapes from other Virginia growers.Our small scale enables us to provide the care and attention to detail required to produce exceptional wines.  We appreciate the opportunity to share these wines with other lovers of fine wine. With each visit you can relax and feel at home.

name: American Way Country Wines
description: WE MAKE FRUIT WINES FROM OUR OWN FARM, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO, APPLE, BLACKBERRY, CHERRY, ELDERBERRY, PEAR, PEACH, STRAWBERRY, PLUM, AND PUMPKIN, SOON TO BE ADDED ARE TOMATO, CANTALOUPE. AND RASPBERRY

name: AmRhein's Wine Cellars
description: AmRhein is a German name meaning “on the Rhein” (Rhine) River. AmRhein’s Wine Cellars is a Virginia family owned and operated, estate-grown winery, specializing in wines with a German influence. Our vineyards were first planted in 1995 and our first crush occurred in 1999. We now have three vineyards (Bent Mountain, Franklin County and Botetourt) boasting 40 acres and yielding 20 varieties of grapes. Our wines have won numerous awards, and are considered to be some of the finest on the East Coast. With over 15 wines in classic styles of both reds and whites and in our own exclusive blends, AmRhein’s tempts every palate!

name: Ankida Ridge Vineyards
description: Virginia’s “Little Burgundy”... Ankida Ridge - The Vrooman Family Farm & Vineyard is a family-run, micro-boutique vineyard, farm and winery located in Amherst County at 1800 feet on the eastern slope of the Blue Ridge Mountains. We grow exclusively Pinot Noir and Chardonnay.  With our first vintage in 2010, we received international acclaim for our elegant, Burgundian style wines.  On our low-vigor, granite soils, we practice sustainable, environmentally sensitive viticulture that offers our wines a true sense of place.A second label of wines, "Rockgarden," is produced on site by our winemaker, Nathan Vrooman, from grapes purchased from area vineyards.  These hand-crafted wines are also receiving high praise.Strictly limited in production, our wines are highly sought after and can be enjoyed at select area restaurants (see website) or purchased at the winery, online or at Early Mountain Vineyards, Madison, VA, where we are a partner in the "Best of Virginia" program.

name: Arterra Wines
description: Born from over a decade of experience producing some of the highest quality wines in Virginia, the Arterra Wines tasting room opened in February 2015, showcasing the wines made by Jason Murray as well as the Gallery and Studio of Hawkmoth Arts featuring beautiful one-of-a-kind fine arts by Sandy Gray-Murray.

name: Ashton Creek Vineyard
description: Ashton Creek Vineyard is a working Vineyard, Winery and Event Center.  We are open 5 days a week to the Tasting Public, serving fine Virginia wines, ciders and select foods.  Specializing in corporate and private events and featuring a relaxed and enjoyable atmosphere.

name: Aspen Dale Winery at The Barn
description: Our philosophy: We strive to produce and serve excellent wine, presented in a fun and unique way. We hope to encourage you to explore the wonders of wine and food. And we aim to insure that each time you visit, you feel at home and relaxed.Aspen Dale Winery at the Barn was founded in 2009, when visitors were first welcomed to the elegant yet relaxed atmosphere of our converted 200 year-old barn. Due to the growth in number of visitors, we now serve both in the barn, and have expanded our experience to include celebrations and group tastings in our 18th century Manor House.The winery sits on an historic 50 acre property in the heart of Virginia horse country.  Corn cribs, a silo, and a smoke house are but just a few of the hallmarks that speak of the agricultural  facets in Aspen Dale's past.Come enjoy a day at Aspen Dale in Fauquier County.  Stroll through grounds where you and your family might meet up with one of our Miniatures.  Climb the hill up to the vineyard with glass in hand, or just enjoy it from your gazebo seat near the winery.  Nothing beats a day with family, friends and fantastic wine in the country!For Parties of 8 or More: reservations@aspendalewinery.com

name: Autumn Hill Vineyards Blueridge Winery
description: Established in 1979 in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Autumn Hill Vineyards has some of the oldest Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon vines in Virginia. Our 13 arces of only Vinifera grapes: Chardonnay, Viognier, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Nebbiolo yield wines of special character and finese.We take pride in producing wine in a European tradition, but with a Virginia accent. Our estate bottled wines are available in limited quantities. Our red wines are fermented and hand punched down for maximum extraction and color,in addition they are bottled unfined and unfiltered. NO SWEET WINES HERE! We are open limited times during the year. Check our web site for dates, times and awards. Phone and internet sales year round. Join the Vintage Wine Club and enjoy our wines. One of Virginia's largest vinifera red wine selections.

name: Barboursville Vineyards
description: A magnificent and historic Virginia estate between Monticello and Montpelier, home to Virginia's most honored winery, founded in 1976 by a family prominent in Italian viticulture since 1821. Producer of Octagon, the most renowned red wine of Virginia.

name: Barrel Oak Winery
description: Relax and discover our destination winery just off I-66, one hour west of DC and a world away. Enjoy award-winning wine, sweeping historic vistas, live music, and glorious sunsets from our extensive patio and picnic grounds. Take a tour of our wine cellar or a horseback ride through our vineyards. Our family and dog-friendly winery is the perfect place to spend the day!

name: Barren Ridge Vineyards
description: Located on the Higgs family’s former apple orchard, Barren Ridge Vineyards is now home to Augusta County’s premier winery. John and Shelby Higgs cleared the overgrown land and planted it with grapevines that now produce fourteen award-winning wines. They also converted their 1890′s apple barn into a state-of-the-art winery, preserving the original structure and wood beams. The Tasting Room features carefully handcrafted wines that are available daily for tastings. The winery is open seven days a week for complimentary tours, and the patio is always ready for picnics and sunset-viewing.

name: Beliveau Estate Winery
description: Beliveau Estate Winery is situated on 165 spectacular acres with on-site hiking, shaded picnic areas, award winning wines, and ward winning bed and breakfast. Lite food fare is available for purchase.Beliveau Estate has been named a top Southwest Virginia wedding venue by Virginia Living Magazine. Beliveau Estate also hosts corporate retreats and family reunions.

name: Big Fish Cider Co.
description: Big Fish Cider Co is a microcidery in Monterey, Virginia making ciders using locally grown apples and traditional techniques to create completely new flavors. Our cider is available in a range of off-dry to semi-sweet blends and seasonal offerings.  Big Fish has won best in show, gold, silver and bronze awards at the Great Lakes Cider and Perry Competition.

name: Blacksnake Meadery
description: Blacksnake Meadery is a farm winery specializing in honey wines, or meads.  Virginia Wildflower honey is used to produce the mead.  Wildflower and Summer Lea meads are produced entirely from our own honey.  Featured wines range from a sweet dessert mead to dry meads which highlight the floral character of the honey, rather than its sweetness.

name: Blenheim Vineyards
description: Blenheim Vineyards is a winery dedicated to making high quality wines that reflect the climate, soil and beauty of the landscape. Founded in 2000 on the historic Blenheim estate in Albemarle County, the goal at Blenheim Vineyards is to bottle wine from single vineyards and small parcels to capture the distinct characteristics of each site.Designed by owner Dave Matthews and master craftsman William Johnson, the winery at Blenheim Vineyards provides a unique and intimate setting for tasting wine. Its great windows allow visitors to gaze out over vineyards to Jefferson's "sea view" beyond.  Paneled glass floors provide a bird's-eye view of the wine production facilities below.

name: Blue Bee Cider
description: Located in the historic Scott's Addition district in Richmond, Blue Bee Cider is Virginia's first urban cidery.Blue Bee Cider produces seasonal, artisanal ciders, pressing apples when they are ripe in the fall, fermenting them over the winter and bottling them for sale in the spring.The name for Blue Bee Cider is derived from a common name for one of Virginia's native bees, osmia lignaria, or the blue orchard bee. These hardworking bees are solitary and wild, emerging early in the cool spring just in time to pollinate cider apple blossoms.

name: Bluemont Vineyard
description: Bluemont Vineyard was conceived in a love affair between agriculture and wine. Established in 2007, This small country winery is a natural extension of Great Country Farms (CSA) across the street. As a small-run winery, an average of 5000 carefully crafted cases of wine are produced each year. Discover a broad spectrum of wines with an emphasis on quality of product as well as skill, enthusiasm and artistry of the team of people creating each unique vintage.The Stable at Bluemont Vineyard is also available for private meetings, events and weddings.

name: Blue Ridge Vineyard
description: Located at the head of the Shenandoah Valley with magnificent views in the heart of Blue Ridge Mountain country. Pinot Noir, Riesling, Gewurtztraminer, Cabernet Franc, and Traminette wines are crafted from old growth vines. Enjoy a picnic and walk the mountain trails on the 300-acre farm. Plan your wedding, reunion, or corporate event in our spacious barn.

name: Bluestone Vineyard
description: Located in the western Shenandoah Valley, Bluestone Vineyard offers impressive views of the mountains and surrounding farm land.  Enjoy the view of our hillside vineyard from our tasting room as you taste our wines and experience a little of the Valley's atmosphere and friendliness.Parties of 8 or more must schedule an appointment for tastings with a deposit of their tasting fee.Dogs on a leash are always welcome at Bluestone Vineyard.  Due to a policy set by the Virginia Department of Agriculture and Consumer Service we cannot allow dogs inside the Tasting Room.  We are sorry for any inconveniences this may cause, but would love for your dog to enjoy the patio and other outdoor areas on the property.

name: Blue Valley Vineyard and Winery
description: Blue Valley Winery is owned and operated by the Zissios family whose deep love of wine and old-world sensibilities are blended into every acre and bottle produced.  World-class, award-winning winemaker John Levenberg, and Assistant Winemaker Tyler Henley complete the winemaking team.

name: Bodie Vineyards
description: We are a small Farm Winery located near Flat Rock in Powhatan County, VA.  We are the first licensed farm winery in Powhatan County.We currently offer two varieties of wine for sale.  Our Michaux Blanc is a semi-dry white wine from the Cayuga grape and our Rochette Rouge is a semi-dry red wine from the Buffalo grape.Group tasting and tours are available.  Please call to reserve a Special Event!

name: Bogati Winery
description: Bogati Winery is a small winery and wine bar located in the old Hill High Orchard building on Rt 7 in western Loudoun County, near Round Hill, Purcellville and Leesburg. Easily accessible from Northern Virginia, Fairfax County, Arlington, Alexandria and Washington, D.C., the goal of Bogati Winery is to provide a respite and escape from the hustle and bustle, a place to enjoy and explore our hand-made, Virginian wine a world away from traffic and the DC commute.Bogati is owned and operated by the Bogaty family (of Veramar Vineyard acclaim). Two generations of our family pour our hearts and souls into crafting the best wine imaginable from grapes we grow right here in Virginia. When you step into Bogati's doors, you enter a world of winemaking that goes back thousands of years and spans the globe. From Malbec to Seyval Blanc to our signature "Fat Ass Red" blend, we want every wine we create to give our guests the best experience that Virginia wine can offer.Our chic, unique tasting room and outdoor terrace are perfect as a place to savor our wines and simply relax and meet friends. We also offer free, high-speed wifi in our tasting room for those who want to bring a laptop and be productive. And since our space is so wonderfully rich in character and class, the venue is perfect for intimate wedding ceremonies, receptions and other private parties when you need an event venue near Leesburg or Purcellville, and an easy drive from Washington, D.C.

name: Boxwood Estate Winery
description: Boxwood Estate Winery is committed to making premium red wines from 100% estate grown grapes in the Bordeaux tradition, but with their own distinct Virginia expression. An area steeped in revolutionary and civil war history legendary for its equestrian activity. Boxwood Farm is owned by John Kent Cooke, a former owner and president of the NFL Washington Redskins. World famous winemaker, Stephane Derenoncourt consults.

name: Breaux Vineyards
description: Voted "Favorite Winery in Virginia" the last 4 years in a row,  Breaux Vineyards is a family owned and operated winery in Loudoun County, VA. The 404 acre estate has over 104 acres planted in 18 different grape varieties.  Nestled between the hills, our vineyard plantings extend up the Short Hill Mountain.Long vistas of the Blue Ridge Mountains can be enjoyed from our tasting room, Patio Madeleine and our landscaped terraces.We are located only an hour from metropolitan DC, Dulles and BWI airports and a short distance from historic Harpers Ferry, WV.

name: Brent Manor Vineyards
description: Closed for the season! Reopening 04/01/2017!Nestled in the hills of Virginia Wine Country in beautiful Nelson County just South of Charlottesville, The Brent Manor Vineyards welcomes you to a mix of the New World and the Old World. When you visit our tasting room, you get to experience our wines, along with other select Virginia wines, and in addition, we are bringing the Old World in as well by offering a variety of Portuguese wines.

name: Bright Meadows Farm
description: Bright Meadows Farm is nestled among the rolling hills of historic Halifax County on the site of a 19th century tobacco plantation.Housed in a beautifully restored 117 year old barn serving seven wines and southern hospitality.

name: Brightwood Vineyard & Farm
description: Winery open by appointment: please call (540) 717-2165 to schedule wine tastings and farm tours.  You can find our wines @ the Charlottesville Farmer's Market on Saturdays from April through October.We are a diversified, organically certified family farm with chickens, goats, sheep, vegetables year round, herbs, raspberries, blackberries and our centerpiece elderberries.  Guest cottage.  See website for more details.

name: Brix & Columns Vineyards
description: Come enjoy our spectacular view while sipping on one of our delicious wines. We are located in the Shenandoah Valley, 20 minutes from Harrisonburg and eight minutes from Massanutten Village.

name: Brooks Mill Winery
description: Welcome to Brooks Mill Winery. A family owned and operated winery located near Smith Mountain Lake in Franklin County Virginia. We offer delicious fruit wines for all personal tastes.

name: Burnley Vineyards
description: Burnley Vineyards is one of the oldest Vineyards in the Monticello Viticultural Area. We have 32 acres of vineyards, Chardonnay, Rieslng, Cabernet Sauvignon, Chambourcin, Vidal and Norton. Burnley Vineyards is a family operation. CJ Reeder is General Manager, Lee Reeder is the winemaker, Patt Reeder handles Sales and Dawn Reeder tasting and tours.

name: Byrd Cellars
description: Located near Richmond & Charlottesville, visit our tasting room in Goochland, VA. We produce 16 different wines white, rose, and red, sweet to dry.  Come see our picturesque Tasting room where you can relax on our porch, sit by the fireplace, or relax in our Winemaker's Loft.

name: Cana Vineyards and Winery of Middleburg
description: Cana is located on a knoll overlooking the Bull Run Mountains to the southeast and the Blue Ridge to the west.  Our spring 2017 wine offerings include: Seval Blanc, Rkatsiteli, Melange (a Marsanne/Viognier blend), Viognier, Traminette, Vidal Blanc, Tinaja (alborinio), Riesling, Rosè, Chambourcin, Cabernet Franc, Touriga, Merlot, Tempranillo, Le Mariage (a Petit Verdot/Merlot red blend), O Casamento (a Tempranillo/Touriga blend), Apple, Raspberry Apple, Blueberry Apple, Rhapsody in Red (a semi-sweet red blend) and Sweet Vermouth.

name: Capitol Vineyards
description: New winery in Delaplane Virginia.

name: Cardamon Family Vineyards
description: Cardamon Family Vineyards is a family owned micro-winery. We make small batch, handcrafted Virginia wines. "New World Wines in an Old World Style"

name: Cardinal Point Vineyard & Winery
description: Ideally situated within view of the Rockfish Gap, the Blue Ridge Parkway, and Skyline Drive. Sample our award winning wines and enjoy the views from covered deck and patio.

name: Caret Cellars
description: Caret Cellars is a family-owned and operated vineyard and winery by R.D. and Junghee Thompson. Located just off Route 17 in Essex County, Virginia, Caret Cellars is an hour northeast of Richmond, 40 miles southeast of Fredericksburg and 70 miles north of the Tidewater area.R.D. and Junghee purchased the land for the vineyard in 2006, planted their grape vines in 2007, and built their winery in 2014. They are both pleased to offer a new spot where locals and tourists can meet, drink wine and have a relaxing time in a friendly environment.Raised in a farming community in Walla Walla, Washington, R.D. served in the United States Air Force and worked as a government contractor before entering the wine business. Junghee has been a manager of a fine jewelry vendor at the Marine Corps Exchange for almost 20 years. Since planting the vineyard in 2007, both have been devoted to growing only the healthiest grapes which are key to producing great wine.

name: Carroll Vineyards
description: We specialize in high quality Virginia wines.Viognier, Chardonnay, Traminette, Cab Franc and Merlot.

name: Casanel Vineyards & Winery
description: Nelson and Kathleen DeSouza opened Casanel Vineyards on October 18,2008.  Located amongst 42 acres in rural Leesburg,VA Casanel Vineyards. We have two tasting rooms; one is our two floor mid 1800s stone tasting room (formerly a cow barn) for our wine club, and our state of the art winery has a new tasting room on its upper level.  Come enjoy the peace and tranquility of our winery!Tasting fee varies, please contact us for details.Groups of 8 or more are required to make reservations a week ahead of time.  All hired cars, limos, and buses are also required to make reservations regardless of size.Our last call for wine and tastings is at 5:30pm.Dogs are not allowed in the tasting room, but are more than welcome on our patio and property. Dogs must be kept on a leash at all times. Please clean up after your pup!Adults with children must supervise them (i.e., be at hand) at all times. We thank you for understanding. Please include them in your number for large groups!

name: Castle Glen Estates Winery
description: Born out of our love of fine wines and delicious food, Castle Glen Estates Winery has become the premiere boutique winery for the best Cabernet Sauvignon in Virginia. After traveling the world and sampling Cabernet from the old world and the new, we decided to make our way back home and bring the world to you.In the world of wine, it is said that "Cab is King." Yet, less than 20% of the Virginia Grape crop is Cabernet Sauvignon.  Our biggest challenge was finding the right, high-quality vines for the wine we wanted to make. Hence, our small vineyard was planted. We are dedicated to offering only the finest Cabernet Sauvignon wine in Virginia. We have also taken great care in assembling a team to provide only the best vineyard management and wine making available.We're small but we're BIG.....Come and taste the experience for yourself.

name: Castle Gruen Vineyards and Winery
description: Castle Gruen Vineyards and Winery is a family owned and operated winery producing hand-crafted, artisan wines. Open since 2008, our boutique winery is located in the scenic rural county of Madison in Central Virginia. Last year was a big year for Castle Gruen as we introduced a new logo and new wines (including for the first time--fruit wines). Our new wines that we released in 2016 are: Pinot Gris, Petit Manseng, Cabernet Franc, Excalibur, The King's Red, Love You Raspberry Wine, Love Sweet Love Peach Wine, Summer Love Watermelon, and Loving Life Tropical.At the present time, Castle Gruen is closed for tastings. We are planning to offer wine tastings again by appointment only this coming summer (2017). We will post that information on our Facebook page (facebook.com/castlegruenwinery) once we open our new winery building. Currently, Castle Gruen wines may be purchased by phone order or at one of the wine festivals we will be attending. A Castle Gruen website will be up for online sales in the coming months."Spreading Love and Light with every bottle of Castle Gruen wine!"January 2017 Coastal Virginia Wine FestJan. 28 Noon - 7 pmJan. 29 Noon - 5 pm Virginia Beach Convention Centerhttps://www.facebook.com/events/1138542376184888/

name: Castle Hill Cider
description: Listed as one of the world’s best ciders. We take an apple-centered approach to cider making. The aim of our technique is to bring out the best of each year’s harvest. Utilizing both tradition and the cutting edge, Castle Hill Cider strives to bring you the highest quality and most enjoyable ciders. From fermenting the Levity in buried kvevri, the world’s oldest known fermentation vessels, to arresting fermentation of the Serendipity with cross flow filtration; from working with growers of varieties truly suited to cider, to renovating an 80 year old orchard, we strive to bring you the best cider to share with meals, friends, and relaxing moments.

name: Catoctin Creek Winery
description: A Micro Winery producing a limited offering of premium wines in a home-based space.Crafted with a passion from crush to label from the finest grapes of our Loudoun County partners.While not a destination for tastings at the winery, we hope you will shop our wines online or at our local retail partners as you explore Loudoun's ecology, heritage and arts.I

name: Cave Ridge Vineyard
description: Located in the foothills overlooking the Shenandoah Valley, Cave Ridge Vineyard produces wines only from grapes grown at our vineyard under sustainable farming practices.  Facilities include a beautiful tasting room with large separate event room overlooking an expansive cobblestone courtyard with water fountain.  A full service kitchen allows for food preparation for private parties and weddings.

name: Cedar Creek Winery
description: Cedar Creek Winery LLC is a unique, small family owned farm winery and vineyard located in the mountains of the Northern Shenandoah Valley, with spectacular vistas along the banks of historic Cedar Creek in Shenandoah County. Cedar Creek specializes in the production of award-winning Estate bottled Cabernet Franc and Chardonnay and is not an entertainment venue.

name: Chateau MerrillAnne
description: Chateau MerrillAnne is a small boutique winery located in the rolling farm land of Orange County, Virginia. We offer a broad selection of hand-crafted wines from the finest vineyards in Virginia. When you visit us you will have great wine and a wonderful wine experience, from our one-on-one service, where you can talk to the Owners about wine, to the rustic and relaxing tasting room. We offer indoor seating in the tasting room, a covered deck area, and huge open meadows where you can enjoy a picnic lunch. Our quiet atmosphere, pastoral views, and great company are a perfect way to wind down from the stress of the work week. Bring a picnic basket and enjoy a day at Chateau MerrillAnne!

name: Chateau Morrisette
description: Chateau Morrisette Winery is a tradition in handcrafted wines on the crest of the Blue Ridge since 1978. Join us for tastings, tours, fine dining, getaway travel with our lodging partners, and events throughout the year, including our famous Black Dog Summer Music Festivals.

name: Chateau OBrien at Northpoint
description: Chateau O'Brien at Northpoint is proud to be a family owned and operated winery, with owner Howard O'Brien personally pouring wine and sharing his intimate knowledge of the wines at the tasting bars. The winery is nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Northern Virginia, and has earned a reputation for producing hand-crafted wines of distinction in a variety of styles ranging from premium dry white varietals, to complex red blends with depth and integrity, and even a wildly popular Apple Dessert wine.Our acclaim lies with ultra-premium individual red varietals, and blends, that are perfectly matched to our mountainside terroir and nurtured with vigilant viticultural practices, including Cabernet Franc, Malbec, Petit Verdot, and our world-renowned Tannat limited Reserve and Late Harvest Tannat.With three intimate tasting rooms and picturesque views from our open-air deck and expansive covered patio, your experience will always be a treat and each visit uniquely memorable.

name: Chatham Vineyards on Church Creek
description: Chatham Vineyards overlooks Church Creek on Virginia's historic Eastern Shore between the Atlantic Ocean and the Chesapeake Bay.

name: Chester Gap Cellars
description: On top of the world. That's literally where you'll be when you visit Chester Gap Cellars at the northern tip of beautiful Rappahannock County, enjoying not only stunning views from the Cellar's open-air tasting patio but truly great, hand-crafted wines.At over 1,000 feet elevation but conveniently located just off of Route 522, near Front Royal and I-66, the Cellars is a prime destination for day trippers or weekenders seeking a tranquil, intimate, friendly place to put their feet up, taste through Bernd Jung's estate-grown Viognier, Merlot, Cabernet Franc, and innovative blends, and let their eyes feast on lovingly tended vines and the endless blue mountains and hills of the southeast Piedmont.What is the wine all about at Chester Gap Cellars? The Jung family's commitment to growing the highest quality grapes and Bernd's commitment to capturing the full flavor of that quality through minimal intervention. High elevation, an eastern exposure, well-drained rocky soils, nearly frost-free conditions, and cooler summer days and nights all add up to grapes that can hang in the vineyard until optimal ripeness is achieved.The result? Well, come taste for yourself.Directions: From Front Royal, take Rt. 522S for 5 miles, then left at Chester Gap Cellars, across from the Chester Gap turn-off for Rt. 665.From Warrenton, take 211 W for 18 miles, then turn right on 522N, coming through the village of Flint Hill, for 10 miles.  Turn right at Chester Gap Cellars, across from the Chester Gap turn-off for Rt. 665.

name: Chestnut Oak Vineyard
description: Chestnut Oak Vineyard is located in the Monticello Region, along a scenic Virginia byway. We grow and produce red and white varietals in small lots including Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Manseng, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Viognier and Nebbiolo.We also produce and bottle at Chestnut Oak wine from other grape varieties grown in Virginia such as Chardonnay, Vidal, Petit Verdot.  All our wines are produced in small quantities, barrel aged in oak or stainless steel tanks, and reflect the terroir of Central Virginia.  They are truly special.

name: Chisholm Vineyards at Adventure Farm
description: The Chisholm Vineyards Tasting Room at Adventure Farm provides a comfortable and relaxing atmosphere, Blue Ridge Mountain views, with 100% estate grown wine, weekly music and food events in season, in a child and dog friendly setting. We are conveniently located near Route 29 and Charlottesville. The farm is family owned and operated since 1950. The vineyard produces Chardonnay, Viognier, Chambourcin, Petit Verdot, Tannat, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon.The Tasting Room & Farm Shop, the Pavilion and Patios offer gardens and a pretty landscaped lake, rolling pastures and an expansive Blue Ridge Mountain view. Visitors can enjoy the beautiful natural setting with a picnic of our wine, local cheeses & salami. On Friday evenings from late March through October there is often live music and food trucks. Other special events are held throughout the year so check our event page at adventurefarmvineyard.com.The Farm offers small lot wines of superior quality made with 100% estate grown fruit. In addition, the premium beef raised on the farm is available for purchase in the shop and is hormone and antibiotic free, grass fed and grain finished on open pastures. We also sell seasonal goods including pumpkins, Christmas trees and turkeys.Chisholm Vineyards welcomes you to unique farm and vineyard experience and to see the pride we take in our wine and heritage.

name: Chrysalis Vineyards at The Ag District
description: Located outside the village of Middleburg in the beautiful Bull Run Mountains, Chrysalis Vineyards concentrates on grape varieties that excel in Virginia’s climate, and our soils, to produce wines that can unconditionally compete on the world stage, including Norton, The Real American Grape!®, Viognier, Albariño and other “off the beaten path” Spanish and French varietals. Our focus is on complete customer satisfaction and "experience" for our guests.

name: Cobbler Mountain Cellars
description: Via Hwy. 66 Exit 27 "Marshall". Follow our state signage 5 miles to the property. HINT: GPS the old farmhouse address~ (unposted)10363 Moreland Road, Delaplane, VA 20144. Call us for assistance. Same entrance as Long Fall Lane, OFF of Moreland. Follow private road back into the property to Tasting tavern on left. Main entrance through top porch.Our story....Starting from scratch after 40 years of vacancy, Jeff & Laura McCarthy Louden & the children have restored the family farm, bringing farming & life back to the Mountain. After years of patience, the farm is seeing its rewards, including award-winning wines and the invitation to serve eight of the wines to the Department of State, Office of Protocol in Washington D.C.Cobbler Mountain... home to the "Little Winery That Could," is where fairies live in big poplar trees, children run barefoot to Thumb Run Creek & stories of the wise Grandfathers and kind Grandmothers are shared around the Grand Fire Circle at the foot of the forest. A legendary dreamer and human rights activist of the 60s, Grandfather McCarthy, discovered Big Cobbler Mountain in 1959. His love of creatures & exploring has been preserved & passed down to his children & grandchildren. Come hike a wooded trail. Open a bottle of imagination. Sip handcrafted wines with the makers. Find a little fantasy under the old apple tree. Who knows who you will meet along the way?We love sharing the newly awakened farm with friends. Please feel welcome to bring your furry companions & mannered children to enjoy picnics (always welcome) on the hillside, hikes on the mountain & splashes in the creek. Come and experience the new Tasting Tavern which opened in March 2014. Sign up for our Custom Wine Club to take part in exclusive membership opportunities & invitations! Follow our Border Collie on Twitter: @CorkyatCobbler. Friend us on Facebook for the latest... and stay tuned here. Many music days throughout the summer.

name: Cooper Vineyards
description: Located in Louisa County, midway between Richmond and Charlottesville, Virginia, our winery was licensed as the 53rd farm winery in July of 1999. Nestled amongst rolling hills in a traditional farming community, our goal is to create quality Virginia wines that express the uniqueness of the terroir and grape varietal. Open 11 am-5 pm: Daily & year roundFriday Night Flights: Open from 5 pm-9pm, with live entertainment, wine flights, and food availableSaturday & Sunday: Complimentary live music during winery hoursGroup Tasting Times: 8 or more people with reservations preferred, 12 pm, 2 pm, & 3 pm Well-behaved, leashed dogs welcome, fresh water bowls are available on outdoor patio and tasting room.

name: Corcoran Vineyards & Cider
description: Corcoran has been producing award winning wines since 2002 and now is offering our handcrafted hard cider.  Tastings of both wine and cider are done in our barn where you can also enjoy BBQ (spring-fall) on our patio. Picnics & pets are welcome.

name: Creek's Edge Winery
description: Open Monday -Wednesday BY APPOINTMENT ONLY!Thursday 12-6Friday 12-8Saturday 12-8Sunday 12-7Creeks Edge Winery is located in Historic Village of Taylorstown, Virginia.  Nestled in the foothills of Furnace Mountain and facing the Catoctin Creek, the estate vineyard showcases Chardonnay, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot & Chambourcin.  Mortise & tenon carpentry, belt fans of days gone by, featured black walnut from the property, a beautiful spiral staircase that is reminiscent of a barrel & climbs a feature that looks like a silo, all compliment the both the history and viewscape of the town & provide the perfect ambiance for an impromptu outing or backdrop for a wedding.

name: CrossKeys Vineyards
description: From the first plantings in 2002 to the opening of the state of the art facility in May of 2008, CrossKeys seeks to welcome guests to discover, taste and experience the best in estate grown wines.  Situated in the heart of the Shenandoah, only minutes from I-81, Massanutten Resort and downtown Harrisonburg, the winery provides panoramic views of vineyards and the surrounding mountains.  Open daily for tasting and tours, the facility houses the tasting room, winery and four distinct function rooms that are suitable for small and large groups.  The spacious courtyard and front terraces provides space to sit and relax while enjoying our Estate Wines.  A comprehensive program in wine education and the arts is a key component of the winery mission. Join us for lunch prepared by our Executive Chef daily from 11 am to 4:30 pm (Nov-Mar)

name: Crushed Cellars
description: Enjoy our warm and comfortable atmosphere along with our award winning wines including Gold Awards in the Finger Lakes International Competition and numerous  Silver & over 1/2 dozen Bronze awards winners at the San Francisco International Competition in both 2013 and 2014.  Conveniently located on rt.9, 1/2 mile west of rt. 287, 25 minutes from Dulles Airport.

name: Cunningham Creek Winery
description: Cunningham Creek Winery at Middle Fork Farm is a vibrant working farm. We have eleven acres of Chardonnay, Viognier, Pinot Gris, Cab Franc, Merlot, and Petit Verdot, a couple acres of strawberries and pumpkins, 30+ Kiko-Boer goats, and two very busy and happy families.

name: Davis Valley Winery
description: Owners Rusty and Ruth Rhea Cox invite you to visit our farm winery and vineyards in the enchanting mountains of beautiful Southwestern Virginia. Drop by the Tasting Room to sample our wines on a 100 year-old handcrafted oak bar.

name: Delaplane Cellars
description: We are a boutique family winery committed to producing ultra premium, artisan wines grown in a select handful of meticulously managed vineyards by growers who, like us, are obsessed with quality.

name: DelFosse Vineyards and Winery
description: DelFosse Vineyards & Winery is located in central Virginia only a short drive south Charlottesville.  Delfosse is inspired by the French Masters. Come taste our award-winning wines while you enjoy our scenic vistas, terraced vineyards, picnic areas, 6.2 mile hiking trail, streams and lake.

name: Democracy Vineyards
description: Located just off U.S. 29 on Rt. 718 in gorgeous Nelson County, Democracy Vineyards' architecturally dramatic tasting room is open Saturday through Monday from April until Thanksgiving weekend. Hours are 1PM - 6PM.  Once a vibrant apple operation, six varieties of grapes are now under cultivation.  Destined to be a true Virginia Farm winery, Democracy Vineyards features ten award winning wines, including varietals and blends, dry and sweet.The founders of Democracy Vineyards, Susan Prokop and Jim Turpin, started with just an idea, a notion of a Virginia farm winery where they could start their encore career as Virginia winegrowers.At an elevation between 800 and 1,000 feet the Vineyards are located to the south side of Rt 718.Noted Virginia Viticulturalist Chris Hill assisted with the establishment of Democracy Vineyards.  By design, the rows are set to run North/South to take advantage of the prevailing wind patterns and to provide the greatest sun exposure to the fruit in the summer months.  The alignment also provides easy tractor and worker access to the vines.Democracy Vineyards is appropriately located in the richest part of Virginia’s wine country the Monticello American Viticultural Area.  According to the Jeffersonian Grape Growers Society:"The wineries of the Monticello appellation fulfill a vision of Thomas Jefferson, whose aim was to produce exceptional quality wines like those he had tasted on his travels to Europe.  Today, 500 acres of vitis vinifera vineyards surround Jefferson's historic Monticello estate.  In just over two decades, the wine industry in the Charlottesville area has flourished, achieving national and international acclaim.  Within the boundaries of this federally designated area are twenty-one farm wineries, the largest concentration of such in Virginia."Our goal is to work with the land to grow excellent wines from the ground up.  Democracy Vineyards is committed to building a sustainable farming operation to enhance the farm and promote agritourism in the region.

name: Desert Rose Ranch & Winery
description: The winery opened in April 2011 and has a unique old western flair.  We are an operating horse ranch and horses will often be seen in the corral by the winery.  Take a step back in time in the tasting room which resembles an old west saloon.  The wines, however, are distinctly modern and have already achieved a loyal following.  The port styled dessert wine served with Virginia made chocolate is the highlight of the tasting line-up which includes eight or ten wines.  The tasting bar is also a treat as it includes money from around the world where the owners have lived or traveled.  We are surrounded by many other world class wineries and invite one and all to spend a day in the beautiful Virginia countryside.

name: DeVault Family Vineyards
description: DeVault Family Vineyards' name truly does say it all. Our family-owned and operated farm/winery, has a "family" atmosphere and the amenities to entertain the adults as well as the children who come and visit us. Our 31 acre farm includes an indoor, heated pool with a bathroom and shower. We have certified lifeguards available for private parties and during winery events. We also have a lighted tennis court, a children's swing set, as well as a children's playhouse, for your kids to enjoy. Our 20'x48' Tasting Room is available to rent for private parties and weddings.

name: Doukénie Winery
description: Located near historic Leesburg, Virginia, in the town of Purcellville, Doukénie Winery is made up of 400 acres nestled in Loudoun County, Virginia’s famed “wine country,” just 45 miles from Washington, DC. This wine farm provides visitors and locals an escape from reality while increasing their knowledge of grapes and wine making. Founded in 1983, Doukénie Winery produced its first vintage in 1995 and has received numerous prestigious awards, over the years. Doukénie Winery produces six white wines, nine red wines and a raspberry fruit wine. Wine can be purchased through the winery’s Heritage Club and in the tasting room.

name: Dry Mill Vineyards & Winery
description: Dry Mill Vineyards & Winery is snuggled into nine rolling acres just one mile outside historic Leesburg in a stable and barn that was once home to the horses and dogs of the Loudoun Hunt Club. Owners Dean and Nancy Vanhuss, with their daughter Michelle Pizzarello, have carefully restored it, using nearly all of the original wood to keep the spirit of the stable intact and give the winery a distinct rustic feel. Exposed wood beams, a tin roof, sconces, and a fireplace give the winery an updated and warm feeling. The original large wooden storm shutters now slide past the winery's French doors, and the loft has two balconies overlooking the attractive grounds. The patio seats up to 30 people for wine tasting and light fare.  For Dean Vanhuss, winemaking is a retirement venture after a career in technology. He has been growing grapes in Loudoun since the late 1990s and currently has six acres planted, most at Short Hill Vineyards, their home in Lovettsville.Owner: Dean & Nancy Vanhuss and Michelle PizzarelloWinemakers: Dean Vanhuss, Karen Reed

name: DuCard Vineyards
description: Boutique winery in gorgeous mountainside setting near Old Rag Mountain, White Oak Canyon, and Graves Mountain Lodge.  Limited quantity, estate grown wines in a relaxed, fun and intimate environment.  Music on the patio most Saturdays, and lots of special events.Our tasting room features patios with great views of mountains, streams and vineyards, floors and tasting bar made from reclaimed lumber from our barns, solar panels to power our operation and local foods to accompany the wines.Unique and elegant gourmet food and wine program for couples and small groups – selected Saturdays and Sundays at 1:00 PM either in winery surrounded by barrels and tanks, or in private events room overlooking mountains and vines.  by advance appointment. Maximum 10 – 20 people per seating. Primarily May through September. More details here: https://www.ducardvineyards.com/barrelroomreservation.htmlRegular tasting fee are $10 for seven wines; seated tastings (includes snacks and tour) are $20.Check our website for details and updates, and send us an email to subscribe to our newsletter.We are proud to announce we are once again a Virginia Green Travel Star Award Winner!We are also delighted to announce that we are the top rated winery in Central Virginia on TripAdvisor!

name: Early Mountain Vineyards
description: Located in Madison, Virginia at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Early Mountain Vineyards comprises more than 300 acres of the historic Monticello Wine Trail. With its warm and inviting tasting room, picturesque outdoor spaces and breathtaking views, guests are welcomed to Early Mountain to enjoy the wines and linger for a palate pleasing experience. Owned by Jean and Steve Case, former America Online (AOL) executives, Early Mountain is committed to showcasing the "Best of Virginia" through our partnership with award-winning wineries  throughout the state and our "eat local" offerings  served each day in our market. Learn more at www.earlymountain.com.

name: Eden Try Estate Winery
description: New!  Garden Estate and award winning Vineyard Barn winery and wedding and event venue just minutes off I-95!  Winery open Sundays 12-5 pm April-mid November.

name: Effingham Manor & Winery
description: Effingham Manor & Winery is a destination for adults located in Nokesville, Virginia, Prince William County.

name: Elk Island Winery
description: Elk Island Winery is named for the 1300 acre island in the James River, originally part of Thomas Jefferson’s Elk Hill farm, adjacent to our farm. Our passion for rural life, agriculture and our love of wine resulted in the planting of our 4 acre vineyard and Elk Island winery. Our farm, Lower Byrd Farm, is situated at the confluence of Byrd Creek and the James River and grows row crop grains. Our vineyard is planted in Norton, Cabernet Sauvignon and Sauvignon Blanc and small plantings of many white vinifera.

name: Fabbioli Cellars
description: The focus of this earth-friendly boutique winery has been to grow high quality grapes, to make world class wines, and to share them in a comfortable, unpretentious, and educational setting. The goal is always quality.

wines.name: Rosa Nera - Black Raspberry Wine - Port Style

name: Fincastle Vineyard & Winery
description: 2.5 mi. off I-81 Exit 156. A family-owned and operated winery producing handcrafted Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Chardonnay. Enjoy the serenity of our secluded mountain vineyard from a rocker under the pergola or a hillside picnic table.  B&B on the property

name: Firefly Hill Vineyards
description: We are a family owned and operated Virginia Farm Winery  nestled away in the mountains of southwest Virginia.

name: First Colony Winery
description: Rolling fields, shaded patios, a spacious tasting room, beautiful event spaces, award winning wines, and a friendly staff are just a few of the offerings awaiting visitors to First Colony Winery.

name: Five Oaks Vineyard
description: A new winery with old fashioned wines. Our wines are grown form their own roots, no grafts. Our Reds are smooth and quite lovely. Our whites are delightful.  Member of the Montpelier Wine Trail.Only Service Dogs allowed in the Tasting Room.

name: Flying Fox Vineyard
description: Located in the heart of Nelson County wine country, Flying Fox Vineyard is a small, family-run winery.  After many years of growing grapes we recently made the leap and started producing our own wines.  We invite you to come by and taste our award-winning limited production wines including Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Merlot and Viognier.  A friendly and knowledgeable staff, winter fireplace and summer patio make Flying Fox a great stop on your wine tour.

name: Foggy Ridge Cider
description: Foggy Ridge Cider continues to impact the cider world by growing amazing cider apples in their 3 orchard farm in Dugspur VA.  Although they no longer make cider they do teach how to grow this amazing fruit.  Look for pruning and grafting classes in the Spring.

name: Fox Meadow Winery
description: Fox Meadow Winery has been crafting great wines using traditional wine making processes for over a decade. Whether you prefer traditional Old World style dry wines like our Reserve Cabernet Franc or Le Renard Rouge, or a light and refreshing aromatic fruity white like our Pinot Gris or Blue Mountain Mist, we have something for everyone's palate. Situated at an elevation of 1700 ft., family-owned Fox Meadow Winery provides visitors with an incredible backdrop to enjoy our hand-crafted, award winning wines.From Washington D.C. Take I-66 W to Exit 13; Follow Rt. 55 E for 1 mile; turn left onto Rt. 638; Vineyard is 3 miles on right.

wines.name: 2016 Fox Meadow Vineyard Barrel Fermented Chardonnay
2016 Fox Meadow Winery Blue Mountain Mist
2016 Fox Meadow Winery Le Renard Gris
2012 Fox Meadow Vineyard Owner's Select Meritage
2015 Fox Meadow Vineyard Le Renard Rouge

name: Gabriele Rausse Winery
description: Gabriele Rausse Winery has earned a reputation for elegant European-style wines. Come discover the story of "the father of Virginia wines".Tasting room open to the public.

name: Gadino Cellars
description: Like our Italian Grandfathers before us, we believe growing and making wine on our own land with our own hands is the most sustainable way to create high quality local wines for our community to enjoy around the table. Visit us and "Taste the Tradition".Gadino Cellars is known for our focus on wine quality. Relax and enjoy our assortment of fine wines. We are a small winery, yet produce over 14 different types of wines including some Italian varietals.Have you every played Bocce? It's a famous Italian past time. We think you will enjoy playing. So come on out,bring a picnic, have a glass of wine and see how you do.We are pet friendly at Gadino Cellars. So bring along your four legged friend and enjoy some wine tasting with us.

name: Gauthier Vineyard
description: Gauthier Vineyard is located on our 110-acre Fair Winds family farm in beautiful New Kent County. We are a new winery with our first offerings in 2014.  Also on the farm is another family operation - Hensley Show Horses – a world class equestrian center complete with a barn full of champions.  Local relic hunters have validated this land’s service as a Civil War encampment for both Union and Confederate forces during the lengthy Peninsula Campaign.Come join us on our large covered winery veranda overlooking the century old pond stocked with bass and numerous snapping turtles.As you sip wine, you may hear horses playing in their paddocks or see deer, beaver, ground hogs, rabbits and squirrels traverse the deep woods while bald eagles and red hawks soar overhead.  We feel blessed to live and work in this history rich region and you’ll notice we’ve named several wines after legendary figures or nearby locations that were instrumental in shaping our nation’s destiny.Follow us on facebook at Gauthier Vineyard for updates and special events.

name: General's Ridge Vineyard
description: Located in the heart of Virginia's Northern Neck (the cradle of our nation), near George Washington's and Robert E. Lee's birthplaces, neighboring the historic town of Kinsale.  Also nearby the location of where three wars raged in the early days of our nation.Lodging available with all amenities are available including two large short term rental homes with large porches overlooking the vineyards near the "Somewhere in Time" tasting rooms.  See website:  www.generalsridgevineyard.comLodging Reservations:  804-223-2GRV (2478)Special Events Coordinator:  Barbara Carpenter, 804-472-4103 or 804-366-1404   Email:  specialevents@generalsridgevineyard.com

name: Giles Mountain Vineyard & Winery
description: Giles Mountain Vineyard and Winery is an estate winery providing unique wines that reflect our dedication to community, sustainability, and our beautiful mountainous region.Our primary goal at Giles Mountain Vineyard and Winery is to minimize our footprint on the land, conserve natural resources, reduce chemical dependence, while producing outstanding regional wines.  Our wines capture the unique mountainous limestone and shale soils on which our grapes are produced. We take pride as the first farm winery in Giles County, Virginia.Our winery is Green certified.  Virginia Green is the Commonwealth of Virginia’s campaign to promote environmentally-friendly practices in all aspects of Virginia’s tourism industry.

name: Glass House Winery
description: In a beautiful setting, Glass House Winery is a boutique winery in the heart of the Monticello Wine Trail, and on the Appellation Trail.   We make hand-crafted 100% Virginia wines.  Our tasting room has a glass conservatory attached, which can house events and music.  Check our calendar for the weekly music we have scheduled to perform in the glass house.  We offer artisan chocolates, made on-site in a variety of flavors. We also have our very own B&B on site.

name: Glen Manor Vineyards
description: Wines with a sense of place from Virginia's Northwestern Blue Ridge Mountains.  Our interest is in estate grown Sauvignon Blanc, Petit Manseng and red Bordeaux blends and varietals.Tasting fee range $4 to $10 per person depending on the number of wines being offered.We are unable to accommodate limousines, buses or groups larger than six.  This six person group size limit includes minors and non-tasters.We do not provide any foods but you are welcome to enjoy your own food from home, here with our wines.

name: Good Luck Cellars
description: Good Luck Cellars is a family-run estate winery in Kilmarnock, Virginia. Good Luck boasts a brand new production facility and tasting room with 12 acres under vine. The tasting room includes nearly 3,000 square feet of wraparound covered porch space and grassy areas for visitors to enjoy a picnic and a glass of their favorite wine. Eight varietals of Good Luck wine are currently available while visitors take in the scenery of the surrounding vineyard in full production.Please visit our website and follow us on twitter and facebook for the most up-to-date events and news.

name: Grace Estate Winery
description: Grace Estate Winery is located near White Hall, Virginia, 14 miles west of Charlottesville in Albemarle County. All Grace Estate wines are made from grapes grown on site at Mount Juliet Farm. For Wedding & Private Event Venue inquiries please contact: events@graceestate.com

name: Granite Heights Winery
description: A small production, boutique winery owned and operated by a devoted husband and wife team. Granite Heights has 10 acres of vines set in a pastoral setting off Opal Road, south of Warrenton, on a 168 acre farm. Our tasting room is in a 19th century farm house with "sit down" tastings which offers an unhurried and friendly atmosphere in which to enjoy our award winning wines.          Granite Heights winery is a state-of-the-art production facility that specializes in small batch production of high quality wines (award winning Bordeaux style reds, 100% Red Varietals, Petit Manseng, Chardonnay, and port-style wines).  Most of the vines are French certified ENTAV clones planted in high density fashion and our wines are produced on site. We have already been recognized by the Washington Post and other wine reviewers for our high quality wines.           We focus only on the wines and let the wines speak for themselves.

name: Gray Ghost Vineyards
description: Gray Ghost produces internationally acclaimed wine from immaculate vineyards. Enjoy southern hospitality, knowledgeable staff, and beauty indoors and out. Experience famous winery events, entertaining tours and the most popular volunteer harvest program in Virginia.

name: Grayhaven Winery
description: Grayhaven Vineyard & Winery produces handcrafted wines that honor tradition and celebrate the rich terrior of Central Virginia.  The winery is known for its signature wines Pinotage, Marechal Foch and Sauvingon Blanc as well as a stellar lineup of vinifera and hybrid varietals and blends.  Grayhaven's fifty acre farm is nestled among rolling hills and surrounded by vineyards, horse pastures and forests.  Visitors enjoy wine tastings and tours, picnics by the pond and relaxing on the deck with a glass of their favorite wine.  Meet the three generations of this family owned and operated winery and you'll see how their love of nature and animals, obsession with food and passion for winemaking help create a unique environment and exceptional wines.

name: Greenhill Winery & Vineyards
description: Experience 100% Virginia Wine in an authentic Farm Winery setting. Greenhill is the foremost boutique destination winery in Loudoun County, Virginia, delivering quality wine, with friendly and professional staff in a breathtaking, hunt country environment.

name: Greenwood Vineyards
description: After a 35 year career of service to our nation, Paul Greenwood returned home to his native Halifax County family farm and became a sixth generation farmer on his 84 acre property.  The vineyard was planted in the spring of 2004 and Greenwood Vineyards started with 1600 vines, consisting of  Sangiovese, Merlot, and Cabernet Franc grapes.  In 2007 another 1215 vines were planted, expanding our line of Sangiovese and Merlot grapes and adding Chardonnay.Greenwood Vineyards started as a vineyard that was supplying excellent quality grapes to other wineries.  These included Rebec Winery in Amherst, Virginia;  Molliver Vineyards in Natalie, Virginia and Hunting Creek Vineyards in Clover, Virginia.  After much encouragement from our friends Milt and Sandy McPherson of Hunting Creek Vineyards, Boyd and Shirley Archer of Bright Meadows Farm,  and Bill and Jane Carlton Confroy, fellow vineyard owners, Greenwood Vineyards & Winery was started in 2010.The winery is located in a 145 year old former tobacco packing barn that has been completely restored by the owner.  The old barn has a tasting room, wine storage facility, a production room, and a primary fermentation room.  In addition, it has an underground wine cellar that is reached by a circular stairway.  A large room above the tasting room is available for private parties and events.Our grand opening was September 17, 2010 with a festival we hosted for the Halifax Village Business Association.  This festival, called ”Soiree in the Hills”,  was a huge success for both Greenwood Vineyards and the business association.  Our second annual “Soiree in the Hills” was held on September 16, 2011 and was another successful festival for both Greenwood Vineyards and the Halifax Village Business Association.

name: Grey Horse Vineyards
description: Grey Horse Vineyards is a destination winery in Virginia’s Piedmont Region. We specialize in boutique wines produced in the European tradition, blending the best of the old world and the new.  The tasting room features a large, stone, wood burning fireplace to chase away the chill.  In the warmer months, guests enjoy the large covered and screened deck.  Live music is featured on the weekends.  The property offers a unique blend of both the vineyard and woodlands, featuring walking trails and picnic sites.  Grey Horse Vineyards is located in Fauquier County, close to Washington DC, Northern Virginia, and Fredericksburg.

name: Guilford Ridge Vineyards
description: Guilford Ridge Vineyard is a winery in Luray, Virginia. Some wineries or vineyards offer wine discounts on large orders of wine. Contact Guilford Ridge Vineyard for more information on their wine discounts and wine promotions.

name: Hamlet Vineyards
description: A Virginia vineyard by Virginia natives with an old Virginia house and a farm hand named "Virginia".

name: Hampton Roads Winery
description: Located at White Oak Farm in Elberon, Virginia, we offer six different wines, including table whites, Red Bordeauxs, and a Hog Island Sweet Red.  The farm offers a walking tour of our property, showing our registered red angus cattle and one of our two vineyards. We have a peaceful patio out back overlooking our pond and pasture where one can sit, relax, and enjoy a glass of our wine.

name: Hartwood Winery
description: We invite you to come and visit us in the beautiful Fredericksburg countryside.  Be sure to bring your children.  All are welcome, and our fields are ready for your little ones to explore while you are exploring our wines.In addition to the wines, we offer light snacks and beverages.  We have a wide assortment of wine gifts for that wine lover in your life. Enjoy wine and cheese on our deck or around the winery grounds or bring a picnic.  We are also dog friendly.Throughout the year we have special evens on site including guest wineries, music, barrel tastings, etc.  Check our list of events or visit our website for upcoming festivals and music.  Come and enjoy Hartwood's warm hospitality and award winning wines.We are also a part of the The Grape and Grain Trail!  Visit us or any of the participants locations to purchase your tickets and your commemorative glass (currently $15.00) which covers all eight stops.  Visit each one on the trail, and get your ticket "punched".  Each location has special offerings and discounts for you!Hartwood Winery, Mattaponi Winery, Lake Anna Winery, Potomac Point Winery, Blue and Gray Brewing Co., A. Smith Bowman, Adventure Brewing, Spencer Davis.There is no expiration date.  This is a wonderful way sample the Virgina wines, brews and spirits available to you.

name: Hickory Hill Vineyards
description: Crafting some of Smith Mountain Lake's best wine from it's oldest vineyard, grown right here for 30+ years.Come stroll our lovingly tended vines. Tour the winery, now in our 16th vintage, and learn how we bottle a lake summer. Taste the difference 100% local makes with over 70 medals & awards for wine quality & agri-business.Crafting some of Smith Mountain Lake's best wine from it's oldest vineyard, grown right here for 30+ years.Come stroll our lovingly tended vines. Tour the winery, now in our 16th vintage, and learn how we bottle a lake summer. Taste the difference 100% local makes with over 70 medals & awards for wine quality & agri-business.We offer award-winning, vintage, estate grown Chardonnay and Cabernet Sauvignon, a popular and award-winning “Lake series” of blended grape wines made in a light & fruity style. Along with local Merlot and Cabernet Franc rounding out the tasting selection.

name: Hidden Brook Winery
description: Located in the rolling hills of Loudoun County, our log cabin is a great place to relax and unwind. Rustic but elegant, we are perfect for intimate weddings, bridal showers and rehearsal dinners. Please contact us with any inquiries for private events or group tastings.

name: Hiddencroft Vineyards
description: Just a short drive from the winery corridors along Rt. 15 and Rt. 9 in Loudoun County and convenient to Maryland, West Virginia and Pennsylvania wine lovers as well!  An authentic Virginia Farm Winery, 95% of our wines are produced from our estate grown grapes..  All wine is produced, cellared and bottled on our property.Hiddencroft Vineyards is situated on a former farmstead in Lovettsville, VA.  Our tasting room is an 1850’s farmhouse.  We hold special music events and tastings in our rustic 1930’s bank-barn during Spring and Autumn.  We periodically open our wine production facility for tours and special tasting events.  Our tasting house and winery are surrounded by our vineyard, butterfly gardens and orchard.  You can sample award winning wines, chat with the winemaker / owners, enjoy our tasting house deck or patio, snack on light fare available for purchase or bring your own picnic lunch.  Visit us and experience "Rustic Charm and Regal Wine" at our relaxing retreat.

name: Hillsborough Vineyards
description: Experience a Revolution in Virginia Wine that is driven by the dedication to handcraft wines made only from grapes that have proven themselves, and not those popularized by other regions. Hillsborough Vineyards is a family owned vineyard and winery specializing in the small batch production of complex wines that are in harmony with the terroir of Virginia.Offering a rare combination of exceptional wines, incomparable ambiance, and unsurpassed hospitality, it is no surprise that most people discover Hillsborough Vineyards through word-of-mouth recommendations.Come and taste what the Revolution is all about.

name: Hill Top Berry Farm and Winery
description: Hill Top Berry Farm and Winery is a second generation family farm located in beautiful Nelson County in the scenic recreation area known as Nelson 151. The farm is appropriately perched in the rolling hills of the Rockfish Valley below Wintergreen Ski Resort. Bring a picnic and enjoy the majestic scenery including the winery's small herd of registered Scottish Highland Cattle! Hill Top specializes in award winning "True to the Fruit" wines made from various fruits other than grapes. Hill Top is the oldest meadery in Virginia,  recreating authentic and historical honey meads.  Try styles once enjoyed by ancient cultures such as the Vikings, Greeks, Anglo Saxons, Celts, Egyptians and Romans. Enjoy a tasting tour of the ancient world, taste the drink of your ancestors and find out how wonderful wines can be beyond the traditional. Open daily, all year.

name: Honah Lee Vineyard
description: We operate a wine tasting room with some well known wineries in central Virginia.We are also a farm market that sells fresh produce, jams/jellies/sauces, baked goods and crafts. Our tasting room and market reflects the rustic ambience of rural America's old country stores.

name: Horton Vineyards
description: Horton Vineyards, located in Orange County, Virginia, is one of the most innovative wineries in the country.  Utilizing the latest viticultural techniques, Horton is charting a new generation of wines made from Viognier, the premier grape of France's Rhone Valley, and other premium varieties from southern France, Portugal, Spain, Russia/Georgia, and Italy.  Visitors are invited to come explore these distinctive wines in Horton's magnificent stone winery.

name: Hunters Run Winery
description: Welcome to the most enjoyable, casual and unique wine tasting atmosphere in Loudoun County where we serve our wines in a beautifully decorated hunt-country equestrian/Irish barn.. We are a small,friendly,truly Irish owned and operated winery in Loudoun County.We encourage you to “wine down” on Rt. 9 with us, and enjoy a bottle of wine by the indoor and outdoor stone fireplaces.

name: Hunting Creek Vineyards
description: We grow Viognier, Malbec, Merlot and Petit Verdot. Our wines are made primarily from grapes grown and processed here on our property.  We plan to continue to develop relationships with local growers that share our philosophy – that a healthy balanced vine creates the best possibility to make exceptional wine! We will release our first "Port style" wine made from Chambourcin grown at Pinehaven Vineyards in the Spring of 2017. Our traditional wines are dry, smooth, and delightful!

name: Ingleside Vineyards
description: Ingleside Vineyards is one of the oldest and largest wineries in Virginia. Located in the Northern Neck of Virginia, Ingleside is surrounded by rich American history. Nearby are the birthplaces of George Washington, James Monroe and Robert E. Lee. This historic estate has been owned by the Flemer family for over one hundred years. Charles H. Flemer purchased Ingleside in 1890, and today one of his great-great grandsons is proprietor of Ingleside Vineyards, Doug Flemer.The winery is housed in the plantation's former dairy barns. The first commercial wines were produced in 1980 and were made from hand-harvested grapes grown in the vineyards. Ingleside wines are produced in the same way they are produced today and have consistently earned top honors in state, national, and international wine competitions.Virginia's Northern Neck is a peninsula formed by the Rappahannock and Potomac Rivers. They are tributaries of the majestic Chesapeake Bay. The Bay is a major factor in creating a stable climate fundamental to grow top-quality vines. The vineyards cover about 50 acres of gently rolling and well-drained countryside.Visitors can enjoy a leisurely tour and tasting, as well as a visit to the Ingleside museum, which showcases local and natural history. Bring a picnic lunch to enjoy in the European-style courtyard. Frequent wine events, including a summer music series, bring together wine lovers from throughout the region. The Ingleside Estate Club offers benefits such as preferred pricing, member-only events, access to archive wines and more.Ingleside also offers two delightful guest cottages, which may be reserved for overnight stays.

name: Iron Heart Winery
description: IRON HEART WINERY stands on mineral-rich, and historical, ground in Allisonia, VA. A family owned farm nestled in the Appalachian Mountains of Southwest Virginia offering a charming retreat where all can comfortably enjoy each other’s company and excellent wine. Railroading and iron mining envelop the farm’s audacious history dating back to 1882, a tale that reveals resilient men and even stronger women.

name: Jacey Vineyards
description: Jacey Vineyards lies in the delightful rural community of Wicomico Church, Virginia.The vineyard is located on a peaceful 150 acre waterfront parcel in historic Northumberland County.The planting originated in 2004 with Vidal Blanc, Petit Verdot and Zinfandel varieties. Expansion began with Albarino, Malbec, Sauvignon Blanc and Cabernet Sauvignon.We are accessible by land and by water. Call the Vineyard for details.Come by BoatYou can also arrive by boat. We are located on Mill Creek off of Ingram Bay and the Chesapeake Bay. We have multiple piers for you to dock with. The Vineyard is a short walk from our piers. We can also pick you up in one of our Gators. Call for instructions 804-580-4053.

name: James Charles Winery & Vineyard
description: Founded in 2015, James Charles Winery is the embodiment of the Bogaty's family story. We make old-world style wines in the heart of Virginia's Shenandoah Valley AVA, which strongly resembles classic winemaking regions in France. Our wines are bold, full-bodied and complex.James Charles Winery & Vineyard is the northern Shenandoah Valley's premier winery, vineyard and wedding venue - located just outside of Winchester, Virginia, it's easily accessible from Interstate 81, US Route 11, Interstate 66, US Route 522, US Route 15, US Route 17, VA Route 7, Northern Virginia and Washington, DC, yet a world away in the rolling hills of the Valley's apple country.Founded in 2015 by the Bogaty family (of Veramar Vineyard acclaim), winemaker Justin Bogaty makes Old-World-style wines like Viognier, Riesling, Chardonnay, Fumé Blanc, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Port-style white dessert wine and Bordeaux-style blends, as well as wines inspired by New World winemaking, like Syrah and Zinfandel.James Charles Winery & Vineyard strives to provide big-city chic with a side of Valley charm, all within the beautiful setting of the vineyard grounds, apple orchards and rolling hills as far as the eye can see. Whether your coming to taste our hand-crafted wine or hosting an elegant winery wedding, this winery and event venue is a class above.

name: James River Cellars
description: This family-owned, family-run winery offers award winning wines from Virginia grown grapes. We are located just north of Richmond, off of Rte. 1 in Glen Allen (where I-95 and I-295 intersect, above the city).Join us for special events throughout the year, including Fridays on the Patio with live music, wine tasting, and Richmond area food trucks. Check out our website for event dates and band listings.Reserve our Tuscan style event room for meetings or private events. In addition, our beautiful grounds are a perfect setting for wedding ceremonies and receptions.We also invite you to select from carefully chosen items in our gift shop or bring a picnic and relax on our beautiful patio or enjoy the view from the balcony. James River Cellars is a quaint retreat, tucked away among the fast paced urban sprawl of our capital city to the south.Directions: From I-95 take exit 86-B (Elmont). At the 2nd stoplight, turn right onto Route 1 North (Washington Hwy). Winery entrance is one mile on right.

name: JBR Vineyards & Winery
description: At an elevation of 1800 feet in the mountains of Giles County in Southwest Virginia, JBR Vineyards & Winery passionately produces small quantities of hand-tended classic wine grapes and hand-crafted wines. We are proud to have established the first vineyard and first Virginia Farm Winery in Giles County. Enjoy a unique experience!

wines.name: 2014 Pinot Noir - Giles County & Pulaski County

name: Jefferson Vineyards
description: Thomas Jefferson brokered the sale of our land to a Florentine Viticulturilist, Filippo Mazzei, inviting him to become his neighbor and to help in realizing Jefferson’s dream for the native production of wine in Virginia. First plantings of European vinifera varieties were in 1774 – in full view of Monticello. Unfortunately the Revolutionary War interrupted this venture and it was not until 1981 that planting vineyards here again regained favor.Thirty six years ago, we introduced quality modern viticulture to Virginia, helping realize Jefferson’s dream. Our winery offers select wines of superior quality and is considered to have “one of the region’s most consistent track records” (Wine Spectator).The wines we offer you are entirely of Virginia. The grapes are grown here on our property and in two select sites across the Commonwealth. We do not buy fruit from outside Virginia, nor do we use any commercial concentrates or additives to intensify our wines. These choices are consistent with our values, and we believe they are true to Jefferson's original vision of winemaking in Virginia. Further, we believe these choices create a better bottle of wine.We are located between two presidential homes (Monticello and Ash Lawn Highland) and are the closest winery to Charlottesville.

name: Jump Mountain Vineyard
description: Jump Mountain Vineyard is a family-owned farm winery. Our goal is to produce carefully crafted, European-style wines with a distinctly local character from grapes grown and processed on the property. Protected by the sandstone knob of Jump Mountain, a local geographic landmark, the vineyard lies on the sunny hillsides of Walkers Creek Valley west of historic Lexington, Virginia.    The mesoclimate of this site provides conditions conducive to growing vinifera grape varieties.   Bring a picnic and enjoy spectacular views of Jump Mountain!

name: Keswick Vineyards
description: Keswick Vineyards, established in 2000 by Al & Cindy Schornberg, is a family owned and operated winery specializing in small lots of high-quality wines that showcase the terroir of the Estate. Originally from Michigan, the Schornbergs chose Virginia to pursue their dream of owning a vineyard after an extensive search that spanned coast to coast.
