Al recalls his grandfather’s stories of working at his uncle’s winery, Massena Cellars in France, and like his predecessor, his goal was straightforward: “I just wanted to be able to enjoy a really good wine that I made. There’s something very natural and satisfying about that.”  With their first vintage in 2002 winning the honor of "Best White Wine in America" at the Atlanta International Wine Summit, the Schornbergs knew they had made the right decision and set out to prove Virginia could also produce award-winning reds.  In 2009 they were awarded the Virginia Governor's Cup for their 2007 Cabernet Sauvignon, further transforming their dream into a reality.  Now, in 2016 Keswick Vineyards received their second Virginia Governor's Cup for their 2014 Cabernet Franc Reserve.  The Schornbergs are humbled and excited that their vision has evolved into a world-class vineyard and winery, with each year's vintage better than the last.  Visit us and taste our wines that are "Born from the Soil and Soul of Virginia"!

name: Kilaurwen Winery, LLC
description: A small,intergeneratonal artisan winery with 10 ac of vinifera grapes---oldest in their 7th decade,youngest in their teens. Wine growers for top tier VA winerys since 1994. Nestled in the eastern slope Blue Ridge foothills, we have a south facing slope 600>800'above sea level, mature vines, and well ventilated site and 360 gorgeous mtn views We'll never be the biggest VA farm winery, and don't aspire to be.  A few bottles of great wines to share with customers and hopefully eventual friends is our goal. We're in the wine business for the wine not the business. We seek to price our creations to cover the costs of production plus a modest margin to be able to repeat the process year-to-year.

name: King Family Vineyards
description: King Family Vineyards is a family owned and operated winery located at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Crozet, Virginia just fifteen minutes from Charlottesville. The winery specializes in the production of ultra-premium wines that showcase the remarkable quality and terroir of the Monticello AVA. Beginning with carefully selected estate grapes, winemaker Matthieu Finot creates wines inspired by the old world, but are uniquely expressive of Virginia.Our passion is the customer, our craft is the wine."When you visit our winery, you are coming to our home.  We hope that you enjoy the fruits of our labor as much as we enjoy sharing them with you."  -The King Family

name: Knights Gambit Vineyard
description: Knight's Gambit Vineyard is over five acres of Petit Verdot, Pinot Grigio, Merlot and Cabernet Franc located in the Monticello AVA on a rolling hillside facing the Blue Ridge Mountains near Whitehall, Virginia. Knight's Gambit was established in 2003,  providing grapes to various local wineries and producing and selling our own wines- a Petit Verdot, a Meritage, a Chardonnay, a Pinot Grigio and  a Rose under the Knight's Gambit label. Our wines are available locally, in select wine shops and restaurants or from us at our tasting room . We are open Friday 2-6, Saturday 12-8 , Sunday 12-6 & Holiday Mondays. Come out and enjoy a glass of wine with a view ! info@knightsgambitvineyards.com .

name: Lake Anna Winery
description: Second generation, Family-Owned and operated, established 1989 on 75 beautiful, rolling acres in Spotsylvania, County, Virginia.  Lake Anna Winery proudly offers Award-Winning Wines from Estate Grown Grapes.  Family, Friendly, and Affordable..."There is No Perfect Wine for All Situations...Only Perfect Times for All Wines".We strive to create a variety of wines to appeal to a wide range of palates.

name: Lazy Days Winery
description: Located on US29 (N Amherst Hwy), just south of Route 151. Lazy Days Winery offers a relaxed down-home feel to a winery. With a large selection of wines, and central Virginia's most unique facity, you are in for a treat. The newly finished indoor/ outdoor amphitheatre is already becoming stage for lots of great event like Sangria Saturday, Virginia Summer Solstice Wine Festival, and Hallowine.Bring a picnic, try some wines, relax and enjoy Virginia's scenery and treasures!

name: Leo Grande Vineyards & Winery
description: The Leo Grande Winery tasting room gives you the opportunity to sample all of the fine wines made on the winery premises The tatsing room staff is passionate and knowledgeable about wine and truly exemplify Virginia hospitality. Located only 12 mins. from Lynchburg, 25 mins from Smith Mountain Lake, and 45 mins. from Roanoke.

name: Lexington Valley Vineyard
description: A family owned Virginia farm winery located about 15 minutes from Lexington in a beautiful setting nestled in the Shenandoah Valley. The winery features small vintage hand crafted wines.  Outside deck and snack baskets available during May - October.

name: Little Washington Winery
description: Little Washington Winery is tucked right into the sweet spot of Virginia Wine Country ... high on the Eastern slope of the Blue Ridge mountains at the North end of Skyline Drive.Everybody's talking about us ... #1 Red Wine in Virginia - George. #3 White wine in Virginia - Shenandoah Steel Chardonnay. One of the top 4 wineries in the State of Virginia. Best View in Virginia - Little Washington Winery. 1 of 8 hottest spots in Virginia Wine Country. One of the top wine festivals in Virginia - Winestock. Best retail wine shop in Virginia - Little Washington Winery's Wine Loves Chocolate shop. Most unique tasting experience -  the Dirt Road Wine Tour. Most popular wine event in Virginia - Wine Bootcamp at Little Washington Winery. Best wine label "Meet Virginia Viognier" and "Que Syrah".We handcraft old world style artisan wines from vines along the Blue Ridge and from some of the most coveted vineyards in the state of Virginia. Come enjoy the panoramic views of the Blue Ridge - bring munchies or get them here and relax on our panoramic Blue Ridge mountain deck.Discover the most incredible wines you'll never find without us ... At Little Washington Winery our tastings are different every day!  Along with our own 8 wines we feature the most incredible wines you'll never find without us on our Dirt Road Wine Tour! Discover something new every time you visit!

name: Loving Cup Vineyard & Winery
description: CERTIFIED ORGANIC VINEYARD AND YUMMY WINES!Loving Cup Vineyard was certified organic in 2012 after three years of demonstrating strict adherence to federal guidelines governing organic farming.  Our vineyard is only one of a handful certified-organic vineyards on the East Coast.  The vines are cared for tremendously, and the wines are expressive of this attention and love.  COME VISIT FOR A TRULY UNIQUE VIRGINIA EXPERIENCE.

name: Lovingston Winery
description: Boutique gravity-flow family winery specializing in traditional Bordeaux varietals as well as more unique ones such as Pinotage and Seyval Blanc

name: Maggie Malick Wine Caves
description: Come and visit our unique man-made wine cave on our 215-acre estate, nestled at the foot of Short Hill Mountain, adorned with several ponds and gently rolling hills.  All of our wines are estate grown in our 20-acre vineyard, and include Bordeaux-style blends, as well as several varietals, such as Viognier, Albarino, Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petit Verdot, Garnacha, and Tannat.  Sit back and enjoy our hand-crafted wines while reviving your senses in the beautiful surroundings.  So that we may give all our customers the attention they deserve, we require that groups of 8 or more call for a reservation.  Check our website for updated information and special events!

name: Magnolia Vineyards & Winery
description: Family-run vineyard and winery, making small lots of mostly Bordeaux varietals, located just off scenic Route 211 in beautiful Rappahannock County.  Quiet country peace, tranquility and great mountain views. Come relax in our cozy farmhouse tasting room or surrounding grounds and "Escape the Madness"!  No stress, no pressure, just magnificent wines!Glenn & Tina invite everyone to read their story at www.magnoliavineyards.com, or, better yet, visit them in the beautiful countryside of Amissville, VA, where you can enjoy the tasting room or surrounding grounds and they'll gladly regale you with their story in person!Please note that some GPS may put our location past the actual entrance.  We are 2.9 miles from Route 211, on the left, just before Dodson Rd.

name: Maidstone Meadery
description: Maidstone Meadery produces a hand crafted, hand bottled mead. We use local raw honey and the purest water known. We do not cook or filter any of our products so as to preserve the vitamins, minerals and trace elements found in honey and produced by fermentation. Mead is the oldest alcoholic beverage known to mankind. Sumerians and their guests enjoyed mead more than 12,000 years ago.  NO sulphites added to any of our products.Inanna's Favorite is made with clover honey. It is subtle, refined and easy to drink. A semi-sweet mead perfect with any dish, dessert or Date.Whiskey Barrel Select is made with wildflower honey.   Aged 12 months in Virginia Whiskey barrels it is smooth, slightly oaky with a distinct whiskey aroma and taste. Pairing this wine with a particular food is impossible. Drink it when the spirit moves you.

name: Mattaponi Winery
description: We are a family-owned winery producing a variety of hand-crafted Award-Winning wines.  Join us in our Native American Indian log cabin (The Tasting Post) and take a taste in time with Mattaponi Wine!  The name comes from the four rivers in Spotsylvania County, Virginia: Mat, Ta, Po, and Ni, which has been used in history to name the Indian tribe once ruled by Chief Powhatan, Pocahontas' father.  The delightful berries of Virginia have been used for generations, and today we bring to you our New World of wines!

name: Mediterranean Cellars
description: Come experience the rich wine making tradition and warm Mediterranean hospitality of our family owned winery. We offer a variety of fine wines and invite you to savor our own Romance-it will touch your heart!

name: Meriwether Springs Vineyard
description: Open for private events only, Meriwether Springs Vineyard is one of the Charlottesville area’s newest winery and event center. Located a mile from the town of Ivy and minutes from the University of Virginia and downtown, Meriwether Springs is part of the original estate of the famed explorer, Meriwether Lewis.The current Meriwether Springs Vineyard property features a spacious and well-appointed event center which includes two separate event spaces, an exceptional tasting room, a full-service caterer’s kitchen, and a bridal loft. The 5,000 square feet of stunning open post and beam architecture allows for exclusive and nearly unlimited configurations for your personalized event. The event center and 40 acre secluded property is not only an unsurpassed venue for weddings but is also ideal for rehearsal dinners, bridal or groomsman parties, as well as corporate events and private parties.The grounds of the estate include a five acre vineyard, prominent and visible from the porch and deck of the event center. The working vineyard is as functional as it is beautiful, with plantings of Petit Verdot, Chambourcin, Vidal Blanc, and Pinot Grigio.

name: Mermaid Winery
description: Welcome to Norfolk's first winery located in the charming Ghent neighborhood. We focus on producing small lots of well-balanced wines using Virginia grapes. Our winemaking process can be viewed from the tasting bar where you can enjoy our creations.You can also choose from twelve different wine flights or select a wine from our list that features 350 wines from around the world. There is also a food menu that ranges from classical charcuterie and artisanal cheese platters to sandwiches and entrees.We look forward to pouring your next glass of wine! Cheers!

name: Michael Shaps Winery
description: Internationally recognized winemaker Michael Shaps produces high-quality small lot wines from various vineyards around Virginia. Michael Shaps also manages Virginia's largest contract winemaking operation.In addition, Michael owns and operates a winery in Burgundy, France and offers tastings of his French wines in the Tasting Room at both the winery and the Wineworks Extended location.  At Michael Shaps Winery visitors glimpse a view into a multi-faceted winery operation where the focus is on quality production with a rustic, industrial feel.Known for his innovation in the industry, Michael  introduced the "bag in box" to Virginia wine consumers and most recently keg wines and refillable growlers available at the new Wineworks Extended location.

name: Miracle Valley Vineyard
description: Miracle Valley Vineyard is located on the gentle slopes of Little Cobbler Mountain in Delaplane, VA. The winery overlooks long vineyard vistas, an early 1800's farm house that serves as the Tasting Room,  two spacious Pavilions, a gazebo, and a beautiful pond nestled in a hidden valley. Grape varieties include Chardonnay, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Viognier, Vidal and Cabernet Franc.   Located on 50 acres of spectacular Fauquier County farm land, Miracle Valley Vineyard and Winery is an inviting place to spend an afternoon or to host an event. Come taste our international award winning wines and see our 9'11" Angel.

name: Misty Mountain Meadworks
description: Misty Mountain Meadworks is now the oldest Meadery in Virginia. Our specialty is producing the ancient "Nectar of the Gods" - Mead, which some people call honey-wine.  The Meadery is owned and operated by the Copeland family and located on a fifteen acre tract in the mountains bordering the Shenandoah Valley near Winchester, VA.

name: Molon Lave Vineyards
description: Located on fifty acres of pristine Virginia countryside, our award-winning wines fuse old world European winemaking tradition with the finest Virginia grapes. Come enjoy our beautiful tasting rooms, outdoor patio, and pavilion with views of ponds, rolling hillside, and acres of vines!

name: Monroe Bay Vineyard
description: We are a small farm winery and cidery located near Colonial Beach, VA 22443 started by Kiki and Walt. We currently sell our wines and ciders at local Farmers Markets and special events and hope to have our tasting room near Colonial Beach open by summer of 2017.Farmers Markets: Ballston Farmers Market - Every Thursday 3-7http://www.freshfarmmarkets.org/ballston.htmlMosaic Farmers Market - Select Sundays 9-2:30http://mosaic.centralfarmmarkets.com/Monthly events:Visions by Shil, Colonial Beach Art Walk - Second Friday 6-8pmhttp://www.colonial-beach-virginia-attractions.com/visions-by-shirl.htmlArt and Frame of Falls Church - First Friday Falls Church 6-8pm http://www.artandframeoffallschurch.com/Home.htmlAlso check us out at:Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/MonroeBayWine

name: Monticello Wine Trail
description: The Monticello Wine Trail currently consists of over 30 member wineries located within the Monticello American Viticultural Area (AVA), which was the first established AVA in Virginia.Each member winery owes homage to Thomas Jefferson’s vision of winemaking and are honored to help fulfill his dream. Member wines are consistently ranked highly in state, national and international wine competitions. Reflecting the high level of quality, which has been achieved in the AVA.The wineries all take the greatest pleasure in crafting their wines and in welcoming visitors from around to world to sample their wine, take in the history and relax among the beautiful bucolic hills, farms and vineyards. With this in mind, we invite you to discover the Birthplace of American Wine.

name: Morais Vineyards & Winery
description: Morais Vineyards and Winery offers great scenery, memorable experiences and a unique wine selection. We craft elegant and powerful wines that reflect the place from which they originate.Located in Bealeton, VA, Morais Vineyards is the perfect spot where you can enjoy a wine tasting with friends, or hold your special event at our venue with our private grand ballroom that can accommodate over 300 guests.The newest addition to our estate is the public Tasting Room and Gift Shop.  This uniquely designed round structures is an elegant and restful space to enjoy a tasting or glass of wine.  A sweeping wrap around veranda offers magnificent views to the vineyards and plenty of outdoor seating. We also offer picnic tables and play areas for a family friendly environment. The Tasting Room and surrounding areas are the perfect location for an afternoon get away.  Bring your picnic and enjoy the day with us.For further information, call our venue coordinator at 540-729-2763.

name: Moss Vineyards
description: We founded Moss Vineyards with the vision and dream of providing people with the highest quality American wines, hand-crafted in a breathtaking Blue Ridge mountain setting in the heart of Virginia. The wines are produced with great attention to the science and art of growing and blending grapes that result in fine, balanced wines. The mountaintop vineyard and winery were designed and built to offer our guests and visitors what is simply one of the most beautiful vineyard and winery experiences to be had in Virginia.Moss Vineyard wines are made with serious consideration to every element that is required to bottle some of the very best wines anywhere in the world. We have an ideal terroir in the historic Monticello wine-grape growing area of Thomas Jefferson's Virginia; the support and knowledge of some of region's - and the world's - master winemakers; and a drive and dedication to produce nothing less than the best.The vineyard is at 1000 feet above sea level and contains 5,000 Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot, Merlot, Viognier, and Vermentino vines. This is a true labor of love and dedication to the experience of being on this mountain, growing some of the world's finest grapes, and crafting incredibly special wines.

name: Mountain Cove Vineyards
description: Virginia's oldest winery nestled in a photogenic cove just minutes off US 29, 30 minutes south of Charlottesville.  We grow a mix of wine grapes and have pioneered in the production of wine from Virginia grown fruit and honey.  We welcome picnics.

name: MountainRose Vineyards Inc
description: MountainRose Vineyards is a family owned award-winning winery and vineyard nestled in the beautiful Appalachian Mountains of Southwest Virginia. The family estate vineyard is the first to be planted on land once mined for coal. Abundant in minerals, the soil gives the wine beautiful rich colors and intense fruity flavors and aromas not found in other wines. All the grapes are hand pruned and grown in the cool mountain air with plenty of sunshine, then harvested and sorted by hand so only the best grapes go into the wine. Visit soon, tour the vineyards and taste the wines while you enjoy the breathtaking beauty of the mountains.

name: Mountain Run Winery
description: A rustic farm winery just five minutes from downtown Culpeper. Our tasting room is set in a 60-year old corn crib!

name: Mountain View Vineyard
description: Mountain View Vineyard is a small boutique winery located at Waterlick, 4 miles east of Strasburg.Home of Francesco Antonio Wines. It sits on a scenic knoll  between Massanutten Mountain and the Shenandoah River.

name: Mountfair Vineyards
description: Mountfair Vineyards, nestled at the base of the Blue Ridge near Charlottesville, is a family owned and operated Club Winery serving our club members through appointment and special events. Mountfair is no longer open for regular tasting room hours.Mountfair produces small batch, hand crafted red blends using the classic varietals of Bordeaux. Each wine is unique — as is each name that graces our labels. Barrel aged for up to two years, our wines are typically medium bodied, food friendly and age worthy.

name: Mt Vale Vineyards
description: In the spring of 2008, Mt Vale Vineyards was established. It was a long time dream to grow a vineyard and one day to produce outstanding wine. The vineyard encompasses 38 acres in the Mt Vale Community of Galax, Virginia, and is only 4 miles from the beautiful and scenic Blue Ridge Parkway. The vineyard is nestled in the Virginia countryside of rolling hills and long range mountain views. Truly a place to relax and forget all worries of a hectic life.

name: Muse Vineyards
description: Muse Vineyards, founded in 2005, in the historic and scenic Shenandoah Valley produces estate wines with all grapes grown on site from the highest quality French certified clones. We are producing a bordeaux-style blend of cabernet sauvignon, cabernet franc, merlot, malbec and petit verdot as well as single varietals. We also have chardonnay and red and white Rhone style wines such as viognier, marsanne, roussanne, grenache and syrah. In 2015, we won the Governor's Award for our 2009 Clio. The vineyard site has been continuously farmed since 1792 and the historic house dates from the same year.

name: Naked Mountain Winery and Vineyards
description: Nestled on the sunrise side of the Blue Ridge Mountains, Naked Mountain offers premium, 100% Virginia grown vinifera varietals, best known for our Chardonnay.  Discover our wines and experience our sensational views from our chalet-like winery, tucked away in our mountain-side retreat.  Family owned and operated, we strive daily to produce the highest quality wines while creating memorable experiences for all who visit.  We look forward to seeing you on the mountain and don't forget... Drink Naked!

name: Narmada Winery
description: Narmada Winery is located in scenic RappahannockCounty, VA, just one hour west of Washington, DC. Shenandoah National Park and Luray Caverns are nearby attractions.Owners Pandit and Sudha Patil have created a space reminiscent of their home country of India that is both exotic and welcoming. The winery is named after Pandit’s mother Narmada. Narmada Winery’s signature white wine MOM is a tribute to her and to all devoted and loving moms around the world.At Narmada Winery, the goal is to make outstanding wines with Virginia grapes. The winery offers a selection of tasting flights, each with a slightly different flavor profile. Reds, whites, rosés, and dessert wines - there is something to please every palate!Narmada Winery’s Tasting Room, Pavilion, and Wine Cellar are available for your private party, gathering, wedding, corporate off-site event or other special occasion. Craft your own memorable event here with us!Open year round! Visit our website for current hours.narmadawinery.com

name: New Kent Winery
description: New Kent Winery at Dombroski Vineyards is a family owned and operated winery located in the heart of the historic Virginia countryside.Everyone in the family is working to bring you award-winning wines and genuine hospitality with a personal touch, ensuring your visit is relaxing and memorable. Nestled between Richmond and Williamsburg, New Kent Winery is a beautiful escape from the stress of daily life and is conveniently located just off Interstate 64.Tastings of New Kent wines and small plate selections are available and can be enjoyed on the spacious outdoor patios and lounging porches, all surrounded by beautiful landscaping.

name: North Gate Vineyard
description: Husband and wife team Mark and Vicki have been growing grapes since 2002 and have been part of the winemaking scene in Loudoun since 2003 as winemakers for a small 1500 case per year farm winery. Now they bring their award-winning winemaking style to their own set of Virginia wines.North Gate Vineyard is situated on approximately 26 acres in the northwest part of Loudoun County, Virginia. Nestled against the eastern base of the Short Hill mountains (foothills to the Blue Ridge), North Gate Vineyard produces high quality wine grapes for its own set of wines. North Gate's Tasting Room is LEED Gold Certified, and is 100% solar powered. It features indoor and outdoor fireplaces, a covered patio, and beautiful views of the mountains and our vineyard.Our wines have won over 50 national and international awards. In addition to the Tasting Room, they are also offered at select local farmers markets, fine dining establishments, retail outlets, and festivals.

name: North Mountain Vineyard & Winery
description: North Mountain VineyardDiscover award winning wines, exceptional mountain views, and storybook setting in the Shenandoah Valley of Virginia! Experience elegant wines exclusive to our vineyard's terroir. Tastings, cellar tours, special events.

name: Notaviva Vineyards
description: What is Notaviva? It is the intrinsic effect of music upon human emotion, or put simply, it is the feeling you get when you hear your favorite song. Our goal in the founding of our vineyard is to capture those feelings and put them in our wines. Be it joy or sadness we endeavor to create wines that will connect our patrons with their occasions.As seen on the HGTV & DIY series "Dream House" our custom handcrafted timber frame tasting room experience is unrivaled in Virginia. The perfect setting for your wedding, rehearsal dinner, private party, or corporate event, our venue offers spectacular views of our vineyards as well as the mountains. A unique built-in performance stage with professionally designed audio-visual system, coupled with wireless Internet connectivity ensures your event is supported by the latest in technology. Founded by Stephen and Shannon Mackey, Notaviva Vineyards is redefining the winery experience.Buy Stephen's book "Dream, Build, Believe"http://dream-build-believe.com/Our downstairs has been converted into an AirBnB! Book your room today! http://notavivavineyards.com/airbnb

name: Oak Crest Vineyard & Winery
description: Enjoy our Bordeaux-style reds and Rhine-style whites in the relaxed atmosphere of our post-and-beam tasting room, unique gift shop with deck and quiet picnic area.

name: Old Hill Cider
description: Old Hill Cider is beginning the fifth year of production at Showalter’s Orchard. The Showalter family has been growing apples for 50 years, and blending and pressing fresh, sweet apple cider for more than 40 years, Old Hill Cider is the Shenandoah Valley’s first hard cidery. Cidermaker, Shannon Showalter, crafts ciders in innovative ways that honor early American Cidermakers. Using carefully selected apples, Old Hill hard cider is simply fermented apple juice that highlights each apple varietal's fermented expression. Don't miss the opportunity to take in the breathtaking views of the Shenandoah Valley, while tasting and enjoying Old Hill Hard Cider throughout the year, and picnicikng, picking apples, sampling freshly pressed un-fermented juice or just taking it easy, seasonally, at Showalter's Orchard, the home of Old Hill Cider.Visit us at 17768 Honeyville Road in Timberville, VA. Please call or review our hours on-line as they, like the orchard, change with each season.

name: Old House Vineyards
description: Old House Vineyards is a great example of how an impulse and passion can create something special The formerly overgrown alfalfa fields are now lush vineyards and the 1890's farmhouse has been restored to an inviting gathering place for wine tastings

name: Otium Cellars
description: Planted in 2007, the vineyard is home to several German varietals including Blaufränkisch, Dornfelder, and Grauburgunder. An exceptionally maintained and grown vineyard, qualities you will taste in the Otium wines.

name: Ox Eye Vineyards
description: Ox-Eye Vineyards was the first vinifera vineyard in Augusta County.  We began planting vines in 1999 and have sold grapes to numerous wineries in Virginia since that time.  In 2010 we built our own winery.  In 2011 we opened our tasting room is in a restored historic building in the wharf district in downtown Staunton.   Come enjoy a glass of 100% estate grown wine on our outdoor covered patio or upstairs in our art gallery featuring a new Virginia artist every 90 days.

name: Paradise Springs Winery
description: Located in the quaint country town of Clifton, Virginia and bordering Bull Run River, Paradise Springs Winery and Vineyard is the closest to Washington DC and the first in Fairfax County. Serving as the gateway to Virginia Wine Country, the property features an 1800’s log cabin, which was renovated in 1955 by a protégé of Frank Lloyd Wright. Tastings are available daily in our 3,000 square-foot tasting room one floor above our production facility. Wine dinners, tours and much more can be found at this intimate, family run, destination winery.Check out our hours and the upcoming events on the right side of this page.

wines.name: 2014 Santa Barbara Sauvignon Blanc - Happy Canyon
2014 Santa Barbara Pinot Noir - Santa Rita Hills

name: Peaks of Otter Winery
description: Our wines are reminiscent of "Grandmas" wines, those old fashioned wines made from a variety of fruits. A venture into vegetables using chili peppers, to make "Kiss The Devil" wine and blend with apple wine to make "Chili Dawg" wine, has been so successful that "Chili Dawg" is now a top selling wine.

name: Pearmund Cellars
description: Voted by Peoples Choice as Virginia's Favorite Winery for 4 years!  Pearmund has 15 acres of 36 year old vines originally planted in 1976. Relax while taking in our beautiful views of our old vines with local cheeses, meats and a glass of the finest in your hands.  We feature our Old Vine Chardonnay but we also offer a myriad of great Pearmund Cellars wines. We look forward to meeting you at our winery and hearing your review of our wines first hand. Cheers!• Best Business of the Week, VeryBestofVirginia.com• Best Overall Winery in Virginia, Virginia Wine Lovers Magazine• Best Small Business, Fauquier County Chamber of Commerce • Best Tasting Room in Virginia, Virginia Wine Lover Readers Choice• Virginia Winery of the Year, New York International Wine Competition

name: Philip Carter Winery
description: There are few places that can boast the rich depth of American wine history that Philip Carter Winery reflects. The family name carries a two hundred and fifty-three year legacy dating back to 1762 as producers of the first internationally recognized fine wines in America.  Located in Hume, Virginia, Philip Carter Winery is seated on 27 acres among rolling hills and vineyards in the heart of Fauquier County's Wine Country.Enjoy a luxury stay just over a mile down Leeds Manor from the winery at The Inn at Vineyards Crossing.  To inquire, go to www.vineyardscrossing.com or call 540.364.2(INN) 466.First Family of American Wine ™

name: Pippin Hill Farm & Vineyards
description: Pippin Hill Farm & Vineyards is unique among the growing number of fine wineries along Virginia’s Monticello Wine Trail. We not only create distinguished boutique wines, Pippin Hill’s Tasting Room pairs them with some of the most elevated bites that you’ll find in these gentle hills. Local, fresh, seasonal, from vineyard- and farm-to-table is how we do things, and always with Pippin Hill’s welcoming sense of relaxed elegance.Pippin Hill’s vineyard, Kitchen Garden, farm and kitchen are seamlessly interwoven. We tend our vines in tandem with growing fresh herbs and vegetables, and Pippin Hill menus and products are inspired by our wines and vines. Grown here, enjoyed here; from vineyard-to-table, everything is fresh, local, sustainable and delicious. To raise a glass and enjoy parings at Pippin Hill is to celebrate the goodness and bounty of this place.

name: Plum Creek Winery
description: First and only winery in Tazewell County! Available souvenirs are ball caps and wine glasses.  Wine sold by the glass, by the bottle or the case.  They can be mixed or matched.  Flavors available are plum, peach, pineapple, strawberry, blueberry, muscadine, concord grape and apple.Please call before visiting to assure someone is available to help you with your needs.

name: Pollak Vineyards
description: Pollak Vineyards is a small family-owned winery founded in 2003  on a 98 acre site west of Charlottesville. Today, twenty-seven acres and eight varietals of French vinifera are planted to produce exclusively estate grown wine that has the finesse and balance of traditional French wines. The more than 16,000 vines are hand-tended to achieve the best fruit. In the winery, many wines are made in small lots to control the process and and carefully coax the best fruit characteristics and blend of tannin.The tasting room opened in May 2008.  It is spacious inside for production and tastings,  with a large veranda and windows to showcase views of vineyards, pond and adjacent mountains. Free outdoor concerts are held on the last Friday in warmer months. In cooler months, the large fireplace provides a cozy backdrop.

name: Potomac Point Winery
description: Since arriving on the Virginia wine scene in 2007 Potomac Point Winery has made quite a splash.  Our Mediterranean estate will make you feel as if you’ve entered Tuscany, only to be up-scaled by our award winning wines.  Only 45 minutes outside of Washington, DC we offer a variety of leisurely activities and events.  With a selection of wine tastings, facility tours and a full bistro serving lunch and dinner, Potomac Point Vineyard and Winery is a destination in itself.

name: Potter's Craft Cider
description: Our approach to cidermaking is straightforward. Use local Virginia apples, experiment, learn by doing, reading, and engaging with the beer, cider, and winemaking communities. Keep it fresh; keep it funky. Our cidery is based in Free Union, just outside of Charlottesville, we are in the heart of apple country at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.All of our ciders start with locally-grown fruit, cultivated with care and harvested at peak flavor from nearby orchards and family farms. All of our ciders start with locally-grown fruit, cultivated with care and harvested at peak flavor from nearby orchards and family farms. We press fresh heirloom and traditional cider apples such as the Albemarle Pippin and Virginia Winesap as well as modern cider apples such as the Gold Rush to create a cider that would make our forbearers proud. Unlike many larger producers, we don’t add sugar or water to our ciders. Our process is respectful of a long Virginia tradition but we are not afraid to push boundaries to make ciders that stand out.Our tasting room is located inside The Bridge PAI, a non-profit art organization, located in Belmont, south of downtown Charlottesville. We are open Fridays, Saturdays, and Sundays with outside seating options. We offer tasting flights, glass pours, bottle sales and growler fills.

name: Preston Ridge Winery
description: Owners Lawrence and Lois Penn decided to build the Preston Ridge Winery in the Spring of 2009, with a vision of creating Martinsville's first winery and its finest wine bar. Preston Ridge Winery offers a wide selection of dry, semi-sweet and sweet wines to suit any palate. We also are the area's only winemaking and homebrewing retail supply store. Nestled at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains and near the Martinsville Speedway and the Smith River Sports Complex, Preston Ridge Winery is the perfect stop along your getaway. Look for our products in local stores and restaurants begining November 1, 2011.

name: Prince Michel Vineyard
description: Celebrate with Prince Michel at all of our locations!At the winery! Prince Michel is the ultimate Virginia Winery experience! Breathtaking mountain and vineyard views perfectly complement our state of the art winemaking facilities.In the Vineyard! High atop Carter Mountain at 1435 Carter Mountain Trail Monticello Virginia 434-293-9463!Enjoy internationaly acclaimed wines in our tasting rooms and shop for the most Unique gifts in Virginia!

name: Pungo Ridge Winery
description: Pungo Ridge Winery is a father - son  operated winery. We specialize in fruit & country wines made from local berries like Blackberry,Blueberry,Strawberry and Pear. We also craft a variety of Meads and well a ,Apple and Plum wine. We are located in the Pungo section of Virginia Beach approx. 15 minuets south of the Virginia Beach resort area , and 10 minuets from Sandbridge Beach. We  are open Summer and Fall only  - 1665 Princess Anne Road,VA Beach,VA 23456

name: Quattro Goombas Winery
description: Welcome to Quattro Goomba's Winery!Nestled in the foothills of Northern Virginia, near the historic village of Aldie, Quattro Goomba's Winery brings The Spirit and Taste of Italy to Virginia.  Our hand crafted, old-world style wines blend perfectly with the charm, beauty and grace that is Virginia!  Our location in the wine country of Loudoun County offers serene vistas, warm surroundings and is within a short distance of neighboring wineries.Come visit the Goombas, meet our friends and family and enjoy the tradition of wine making that has been passed on to us over many generations.  We look forward to introducing you to our special wines and sharing our beautiful winery with you, your friends, and family.  We know you will enjoy the peaceful surroundings and warm welcome that have become a Goomba tradition. By the time you leave, you just might be a Goomba too!

name: Quievremont
description: Quievremont Wine is a boutique Farm Winery specializing in Bordeaux style wines made from estate grown grapes. Quievremont winery and vineyard are located at the heart of Reality Farm, established circa 1753 on the foothills of the Blue Ridge mountains.  Reality Farm was purchased by John and Teri Guevremont in 2006, the vineyard was planted in 2008 and the first production wines were made in 2011.   Reality Farm operates a  dairy and beef herds, as well as free range chickens and goats. The farm also maintains a vacation cottage adjacent to the winery for visitors to enjoy our agri-tourism and country amenities. Located within minutes of the Inn at Little Washington, the Blue Rock Inn, Luray Caverns, Civil War battlefields and numerous other tourist attractions and wineries.

name: Ramulose Ridge Vineyards
description: Come taste our unique variety of wines and check out our tasting room. Bring a picnic, choose your favorite bottle of wine and enjoy the spanning views of the Blue Ridge Mountains while relaxing on our patio.

name: Rappahannock Cellars
description: Recognizing the promise in Virginia wines, we moved our family’s winery from California to the Blue Ridge Mountains in the heart of Virginia’s hunt country, in Rappahannock County.  Here in Virginia we continue to create rich and elegant wines dedicated to the winegrower’s art. Open daily year-round since 2001, we have established ourselves as a leader at the forefront of the Virginia wine industry.  Our experienced wine making team, coupled with careful tending of the vineyard and exacting knowledge of the cellar, is producing exquisite, internationally recognized wines.Whether it’s wine tasting, touring, or celebrating a special occasion, we strive to make your visit to our tasting room a memorable experience. Our wines are poured in distinct glasses, showcasing our white, red and dessert wines.And as a family owned (and operated) business, don’t be surprised to be served by one of our own. So visit us soon and enjoy the warmth and hospitality that only a family nurtured winery can provide.Rappahannock Cellars is open year around.  Come, taste, and enjoy Virginia wine at its finest.Rappahannock Cellars - Revolutionizing Virginia Wine

name: RdV Vineyards
description: RdV Vineyards is nestled in the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains 60 miles outside of Washington DC. Our hillside vineyards & winery, above the historic town of Delaplane, offer the perfect blend of southern-exposed slopes and rocky soil to establish the ideal ‘terroir’ to fulfill our desire to reconnect with the land, create a wine with soul, and provide a destination for wine enthusiasts from all over the world to gather together and share their passion for food and wine.The best way to fully experience this this unique property is through hosted tours throughout the winemaking facilities culminating in a seated tasting of our current release wines with carefully matched food pairings by local Virginian artisans.

name: Rebec Vineyards Inc
description: We hand-crush local grapes, hand-pump the juice, hand-transfer the wine, hand-bottle and hand-label! Truly a local "hands on" operation! What sets Rebec Vineyards apart from the rest is the tender loving care each bottle receives.  Svet Kanev, winemaker, croons to the wine as he bottles.  The secret is not in the tonality of his singing (just ask his assistant) but in the songs themselves, which are Bulgarian folk tunes!Opened to the public in 1987, Rebec's selection has grown to over 15 distinct wines, including Viognier, Gewurztraminer, sweet Riesling, Pinot Noir, Cabernet Sauvignon, the blends Autumn Glow and Sweet Sofia, and our new fruit wines, Cherry and Pear.Rebec's Wine and Garlic Festival, annually since 1991, is one of Virginia's largest festivals and is held on the second full weekend in October.  Join us for a stinking good time!

name: Reynard Florence Vineyard
description: There have been a lot of newcomers to Virginia wine over the last few decades and while Reynard Florence is only a few years old, founders and proprietors  Roe and Dee Allison are no strangers to the rolling hills of the Blue Ridge. The two, purchased the land where Reynard Florence is located shortly after they were married in 1976. Roe and Dee built their house in 1980 which overlooks the vineyard today. The couple raised their two sons, who also attended local schools, in that home. Instilled with a firm belief in maximizing the land's potential, Roe and Dee began planning a vineyard on the land where they had built their lives. Breaking ground in April '06 with only one half acre Petit Manseng vines, Reynard Florence has since expanded to include over 2 acres of Grenache, Petit Verdot, and Merlot. Under the direction of veteran vineyard consultant Chris Hill and winemaker Michael Shaps, Reynard Florence’s premier vintage in 2009 of Petit Manseng reflected not only the Allison’s love for the region, but also the care that went into the vineyard’s design and vine maintenance.

name: Rockbridge Vineyard
description: Nestled in the historic Valley of Virginia between the Blue Ridge and Allegheny Mountains, Rockbridge Vineyard produces a wide range of award winning wines. Groups of ten or more we request reservations.

name: Rogers Ford Farm Winery
description: People struggle with the hectic pace of modern life. I have a peaceful retreat from the dizzying rush. Come share some wine, rediscover your friendships and reconnect with someone you love. Visit this weekend!

name: Rosemont Vineyards & Winery
description: From Bud Break to BottleAt Rosemont Vineyards, we have the distinct pleasure of growing every grape used in our wines.  Being involved in every aspect of winemaking, from bud break to harvest and bottling, allows us to produce wines of the greatest quality that showcase this great Virginia terroir.Rosemont Vineyards is a family-owned and operated establishment located on the 450 acre Rosemont Estate near beautiful Lake Gaston. The estate has been in the Rose Family since 1858.You'll discover that we combine our knowledge of this land wit modern winemaking techniques to produce premium handcrafted wines, all of which are 100% estate grown, produced and bottled.We invite you to come visit our beautiful early American Style building – take a tour, enjoy a glass of our award winning wines, shop our gift store or browse our extensive local arts and crafts gallery!

name: Rural Retreat Winery & Vineyards
description: Well known for making fine wine for since 1996, the Dye's tradition continues in Rural Retreat. Our wine selection includes full body reds from locally grown Steubens and DeChaunacs and lovely whites from fruity Rieslings, Vidal Blancs, Traminettes and Chardonnays. Full service deli featuring Amish style meats and cheeses and serves light fare sandwiches, soups and salads. Join us in Rural Retreat, relax on our large porch and enjoy a delightful glass of wine.

name: Sans Soucy Vineyards
description: We are a small family owned and operated farm winery located in the historic tobacco country in Brookneal Virginia, the 1st farm winery in Campbell county, just minutes away from Red Hill Patrick Henrys last home and resting place and within a 30 minute drive from historic Appomattox and the cities of Lynchburg and South Boston. In addition we are conveniently located less than two hours from Charlottesville, Farmville, Bedford, Roanoke and Danville Virginia, as well as Raleigh, Durham and Greensboro, NC. The winery and tasting room are located in a century old restored barn and school house with all the original wood work. We grow a variety of vinifra and hybrid vines on 7 acres and we have an additional acre planted with heirloom apple trees. Our first planting was in 2000 with our first crush in 2006. In 2016 we also became a brewery, Staunton River Brewing Co, stop by and enjoy some wine , beer and Sangria! Live music every Saturday!  Food Truck every Thursday & Friday 5-7 and  Saturday's 1-7 Self contained RV's and tent campers are welcome to overnight.

name: Sassafras Shade Vineyard
description: We are a small family owned and operated vineyard and winery located just 4 miles west of I-95 exit 110 (Ladysmith.) Our rustic tasting room opened in October of 2014 featuring Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc, Chambourcin, Vidal Blanc, Cayuga White, and White Chambourcin.  We have since expanded our line-up with Granny Smith Apple, Caroline White, and Caroline Red.  All grapes are grown on premises and all wines are produced and bottled here.

name: Saudé Creek Vineyards
description: Situated high on a hillside adjacent to the Pamunkey River, breathtaking views and a rich history welcome you to Saude Creek Vineyards. The rolling landscape of the vineyard is accentuated by the grandeur of the tasting room. Frank's Tavern, a colonial inn and publick house, was once located on our winery site. Frank's was a favorite stop for wayfarers riding between points north or west and the Colonial capitol of Williamsburg. George Washington and the French General Rochambeau, among other patriots and notables of the time, reputedly slaked their thirst here. Boasting two decks, two patios, an event pavilion, and an outdoor stage, Saude Creek is a favorite for both locals and travelers alike with live music and fantastic food vendors each weekend. We at Saude Creek, invite you to sit back and relax with our beautiful views and award-winning wines.

name: Seven Doors Winery
description: Welcome to an oasis of amazing energy and beauty. Seven Doors Winery is a retreat center for mind, body and spirit events, as well as a start up winery with a dream to make organic wine. We seek harmony in everything we do, which is why we are using biodynamic practices on our land and a beautiful zen like vibe in our tasting room and grounds. We offer a unique package for weddings, and corporate outings. Definitely not traditional! Email us to discuss what cool options we can create for you, whatever the occasion. Or stop by and visit us for a tasting or a picnic. Dogs not only welcome, but preferred. Hours vary due to private events, but mostly open weekends Noon to 4.

name: Sharp Rock Vineyards
description: A 220 year old family farm located on the beautiful Hughes River in an unspoiled valley at the foot of Old Rag Mountain.We craft twelve award-winning wines produced in limited quantities from handpicked grapes grown in our own vineyards,and sold only in our renovated 100 year old barn tasting room.

name: Shenandoah Vineyards
description: Shenandoah Vineyards, founded in 1976, is Shenandoah Valley's oldest winery and is also the second oldest winery in Virginia. Award-winning wines made in the European tradition using modern techniques and. We have a wine for every palate and every occasion. The winery is in an old Civil War era barn. Come experience the tours and tastings of our wines, enjoy a picnic on the decks overlooking the vineyard and the beautiful Massanutten mountains, and shop in our unique wine-related gift shop.

name: Skippers Creek Vineyard
description: Skippers Creek Vineyard is located on property owned by Debbie’s family for over 75 years. Growing up, dairy and tobacco farming filled her day with many hours of hard work. Today, sitting about 300 feet above sea level, the pastures thrive with five acres of viniferous vines.

name: Slater Run Vineyards
description: One vineyard, two venues.For nearly 300 years, the Slater family has farmed land in Upperville along Goose Creek. Hay, grain, horses, beef cattle, and now, vines and wine sustain this tradition.Slater Run Vineyards Tasting Room is located at 9030 John S Mosby Hwy, Upperville, VA 20184 and is open year round, Thursday through Saturday from 12 pm - 7 pm and Sunday from 12 pm - 5 pm.Slater Run Vineyards Winery is located at 1500 Crenshaw Road, Upperville, VA 20184 and is open the first weekend of the month from May through October: May 6-7, June 3-4, July 1-2, August 5-6, September 2-3, October 7-8 from 12 pm - 6 pm. The winery is also available for private tastings, tours and events.Visit our website www.slaterrun.com to stay up to date with our upcoming events!

name: Spring Run Vineyards
description: Spring Run Vineyards is a family-owned and operated boutique “nano-” Virginia Farm Winery. We pride ourselves on hand-crafting quality wines by concentrating on hybrid varieties that excel in Virginia’s extreme climate and withstand minimal spraying requirements. We have been growing wine grapes since 2005 and will grow to 3 acres. We also grow blackberries and produce small lots of fine Blackberry wines. Be sure to check out the latest information on our Facebook page at "Spring Run Vineyards"

name: Stanburn Winery
description: Just like our vineyard, Stanburn Winery is a family adventure. Since 1999, our family has owned and operated a 15-acre vineyard in rural, scenic Patrick County, Va. We now take our passion for growing grapes to bring you our wines bursting with flavor. We nurture five grape varieties including, Chardonnay, Traminette, Cabernet Franc, Vidal Blanc, Chambourcin, and Barbera. We offer 12 wines varying from dry to semi-sweet to sweet. Thanks for giving Stanburn Winery a try, and we hope you like it as much as we have enjoyed making it for you.

name: Stinson Vineyards
description: Stinson Vineyards is a family run boutique vineyard located just West of Charlottesville in the scenic foothills of Virginia's Blue Ridge Mountains.  Nestled in "downtown" White Hall, the winding driveway boasts some of the area's best views.  A repurposed garage winery combines modern architecture and equipment with traditional winemaking techniques.

name: Stone House Meadery
description: Stonehouse Meadery is a small family owned and operated winery, that use local  honey to ferment into wine. We focus on making high quality mead using local honey and 21st century knowledge. Our goal is to produce good mead on a small scale with the highest quality. The meadery will offer 3-5 different wines to the public begining early spring, 2013.

name: Stone Mountain Vineyards
description: Located at 1,700 feet, Stone Mountain Vineyards provides a unique perspective from their expansive observation deck. The large tasting room features rich hardwood flooring, comfortable gathering areas and a heartwood Pine Tasting Bar. While looking over the observation deck to the valley below and with a glass of Stone Mountain Cabernet Franc in hand, the true vision of Stone Mountain Founder Al Breiner and Founding Winemaker Chris Breiner can be seen, tasted, and fully appreciated.Relax on the observation deck, glass in hand and look out across the valley. As a hawk rides the thermals down to the valley floor, you sip — then you can see, feel and taste the essence of Stone Mountain Vineyards.

wines.name: Bacon Hollow Revenuers' Select White Wine

name: Stone Tower Winery
description: Stone Tower Winery is a family-owned and -operated winery, where our premium wines and magnificent views are equally matched by impeccable hospitality. Working with a team of top-notch viticulturists, soil specialists and oenologists, we've created over 50 acres of stunning vineyards of classic French varietals on our 206 acre property atop Hogback Mountain in Leesburg, Virginia. Our commitment to authentic quality and stewardship of the land is reflected in every aspect of our process. From bud to grape to bottle, this attention to detail allows us to create spectacular wines.

name: Sunset Hills Vineyard
description: Sunset Hills Vineyard is all about exceptional wine, conservation and sustainability. We grow our grapes on our five farms to make award winning Virginia wine from the nearly 80,000 vines we tend by hand.  We are dedicated to being gentle on the land and by using Virginia sunshine twice: first to ripen over 80 acres of Virginia grapes and again with 180 solar panels to produce enough electricity to power the winery and winemaking operations.Our tasting room is in a large elegant 145 year old historic post and beam barn restored by six Amish brothers saved from development.  Beautifully restored, it is a golden and "cathedral like barn " with upper and lower decks,   Our decks offer amazing views of the Blue Ridge mountains and stunning sunsets.Come uncork a great sunset!

name: Tarara Winery
description: Wines with site in mind.  We aim to craft wine that is the best representation of a place and time to showcase our unique sites and vintages.  Our vineyards are planted to Chardonnay, Viognier, Petit Manseng, Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Tannat and Petit Verdot.  Bottlings include Nevaeh Vineyard Red and White, Tranquility Vineyard Red, Chardonnay, Cabernet Franc and a white and red blend called Charval and Long Bomb.

name: Terra Nebulo Vineyards
description: New winery opened 2015 in Waterford VA. Amish timber frame construction with  unique inside features and use of reclaimed wood.  Set outside the 1733 Quaker Village of Waterford with gorgeous views.

name: The Barns at Hamilton Station Vineyards
description: The Barns at Hamilton Station Vineyards, located in Hamilton, VA  showcases hand crafted wines made from Virginia grapes on a former historic dairy farm in western Loudoun County.  Our restored 105 year old barn with upper and lower levels; an expansive deck and large patio, milk house and former smoke house offer beautiful views overlooking a pond. Tasting fee is $8.00. Groups of 8 or more are required to make reservations and the tasting fee is $13.00. Our last call for wine and tastings on Thurs/Sat/Sun/Mon is at 5:30pm unless we have a special event in which case we close at 5pm. Fridays we stay open until 8pm.  Please check our website for updates.  We hope you come and visit us soon!

name: The Dog and Oyster Vineyard
description: The Dog and Oyster Vineyard is the vineyard of The Hope and Glory Inn. This boutique hotel has been  “Top 10 in America” – five times.The quirky name was created to honor the rescue dogs that rescue the grapes from deer and other animals; and, to honor the oyster, one of the Chesapeake Bay region’s and Virginia's greatest assets.Our wines were crafted to be paired with oysters - the only vineyard in America doing so.All of our wines have earned many medals from America's #1 competition in San Francisco to Virginia's Governor's Cup. High marks also come from The Washington Post and the Richmond Times Dispatch wine critics.Home to the 2015 Virginia Wine and Oyster Classic.

name: The Hague Winery
description: Located on the Northern Neck at Buena Vista farm, established in 1840 by Colonel Thomas Brown. Tasting room located in historic barn overlooking vineyards, manor home and cottage.  Now open. Hours:  open daily 11am-5pmDirections: From the North: Rte 3 to Montross.  Left on Rte 202 (Cople Hwy) for 8.9 miles.  Winery on right. Fine wines in an historic setting.

name: The Homeplace Vineyard
description: The Homeplace Vineyard, located in Southside Virginia's Pittsylvania County, was incorporated in 2004 by Joe and Brenda Williams along with their children Renee and husband Billy, Jesse and wife Penny, and Mary and husband Chris.The Homeplace farm has been in our family for four generations, and we are proud of our heritage.  This farm was originally purchased by Joe's grandparents, Archer L. and Lizzie Yeatts, in 1912.Traditionally a tobacco farm, we planted our first grapes, Traminette, in March, 2005.  We added Cabernet Sauvignon, Chambourcin, and Viognier over the next three years respectively. We currently are tending approximately 5,600vines on just over 9 acres.

name: The Vineyards & Winery at Lost Creek
description: The Vineyards & Winery at Lost Creek is a 50-acre boutique winery nestled in the rolling hills of Northern Virginia just outside of Leesburg, Virginia. Tucked away between Route 15 and the Potomac River, Lost Creek Winery is a scenic destination that offers high quality Virginia wines in a casual elegant atmosphere.Lost Creek's winemaking style is focused on Burgundy and Bordeaux style wines. These French varietals including Chardonnay, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Petit Verdot produce beautiful fruit in Virginia. Lost Creek is focused on producing the highest quality wines, therefore all grapes are hand-picked and sorted to ensure only the highest quality fruit is used in Lost Creek's wine.  After de-stemming and crushing, the wines are barrel aged in French oak barrels for 18 to 24 months, thus producing elegant yet complex style wines.

name: The Wine Reserve at Waterford
description: The Wine Reserve at Waterford is a convenient escape for wine lovers. We are located just minutes from downtown Leesburg, near the historic Quaker Village of Waterford. We complement our wines with a seasonal selection from small production wineries from around Virginia and regions beyond. Food is available for purchase or pack a picnic to enjoy on our sprawling grounds. The vineyard’s gently sloping fields where Mosby's Rangers once camped can be viewed along with the spectacular views of the Blue Ridge and Catoctin Mountains from our surrounding decks and tasting room.

name: The Winery at Bull Run
description: Cradled in the foothills of the Bull Run Mountains, adjacent to over 5,000 countryside acres of the Manassas National Battlefield Park, you'll find our historic property specializing in artisanal wine tasting experiences. The Winery at Bull Run transports you to the 1800s in an authentic Virginia farm setting that values American history and hospitality. Visit us and enjoy the cultural heritage of a Virginia past and the award-winning wines of the present.As the closest winery to Washington, D.C., we are conveniently located in Fairfax County, Virginia, less than a half hour from DC and only 2 miles off Interstate 66. Wine tastings are offered daily. No reservation is required for groups of 7 or less. Group wine tastings are available for 8-20 people by reservation on our website only.Rich in history and charm, The Winery at Bull Run makes the perfect backdrop for weddings, events, and meetings.

name: The Winery at La Grange
description: Prince William County's premier winery is nestled at the foot of Bull Run Mountain.  Explore the 20 acre estate, picnic with friends while enjoying live music on weekends or settle into a fire lit parlor room once the winter cold settles in. Tastings in the lovingly restored 18th century Manor House are available seven days a week.

name: Thistle Gate Vineyard
description: A family-owned and operated vineyard located near historic Scottsville, VA with a reputation of southern hospitality.  A large tasting room with tables, expansive decks, gazebo and gardens are all available for your enjoyment.  Bring a picnic or enjoy our tasty light fare that go with award winning wines ranging from dry whites through hearty red ports. Music on most Sundays and evening Saturday shows monthly.Tasting room, Winery, Picnic area.

name: Three Fox Vineyards
description: Three Fox Vineyards is a boutique winery nestled on 50 rolling acres in the heart of Northern Virginia horse country.Proprietors Holli and John Todhunter have combined their passion for life, wine and Italy to bring a little of "La Dolce Vita" to Virginia.Come sample award winning wines from unique Italian estate varieties such as Sangiovese, Nebbiolo and Pinot Grigio.   We are also tasting Chardonnay, Viognier, Cabernet Franc, Merlot and Chambourcin done as a port alternative.Bring a picnic and relax in a setting reminiscent of Tuscany.  You can sit and enjoy your wine outside on the patios, in the vines, in the meadow with winemobile service or on one of many other scenic spots on the property.Three Fox Vineyards is located at Exit 23 off Route 66 in Delaplane, VA.  We're just 40 minutes from the Washington beltway.TASTING ROOM HOURS:Thurs, Fri, Sat and Mon: 11:00am - 5:00pmSunday: Noon - 5:00pmGroups (8 or More) by Appointment

name: Three Sisters of Shiney Rock
description: The farm is owned by the Powell Family Sisters, (Beth Graham, Susan Coates, and Kay Candelora). The winery is operated by The Three Sisters and their supporting families. All operations including picking, processing, and bottling are done by the family. The winery was licensed in 2011. We currently offer Muscadine and Scuppernong Wines for sale. As of now, we sell from the farm property only.

name: Tomahawk Mill Winery
description: Tomahawk Mill Winery is located in a 121 year old grist mill built by an exceptional gentleman who served as a Confederate soldier in Pickets Brigade. This mill operated for 100 years before closing in 1980.  Shortly thereafter, a vineyard was planted on the hill above the mill and the start of a winery was installed in two silos which were storage units for grain at the mill.Since that time the winery has been upgraded to a small state of the art operation producing 13 quality wines. Our tasting room is in the mill which is being slowly restored. Come and enjoy the beauty and history which accompanies this place.  Taste our wines and enjoy a picnic by the restored pond and mill dam.

name: Trump Winery
description: From our award-winning wines to memorable events to our world-class accommodations, there are innumerable ways to experience the magic of Trump Winery. We pride ourselves in creating the finest terroir-driven sparkling, white, and red wines, which have won numerous national and international gold medals and best-in-class designations.Whether you visit for a meal and glass of wine in the Tasting Room, to celebrate a friend’s wedding at one of our stunning venues, or for a relaxing stay in the luxurious accommodations at Albemarle Estate, this power of place permeates beyond our wines and is felt as soon as you step onto our nearly 1,300 acre estate. With a robust and lively local food and music scene, Charlottesville was named “one of the top five destinations in the country” by Travel & Leisure and also earned a “best town for food lovers” award by Wine Magazine. Now it’s your turn. We invite you to experience firsthand why Wine Enthusiast named Virginia wine country as one of the “Top 10 Best Wine Travel Destinations.” Plan your experience at Trump Winery today.Tastings are held from 10am-4pm, Wed-Mon, are $12, and include a Trump Winery logo Riedel wine glass. Our educated wine team will guide you through your tasting, explaining our wines and wine-making process. Enhance your visit by ordering from our gourmet seasonal menu while enjoying our warm atmosphere and stunning vineyard views.Group Reservation Policy:  Groups of 8+ require a reservation. Groups without a reservation will not be accommodated. To book a group or review our group policy, visit https://www.trumpwinery.com/images/uploads/Trump_Winery_Group_Policy.pdf

name: Turk Mountain Vineyards
description: Access to the winery is not practical for public use. With 5 Acres planted in reds (Petit Verdot, Cab. Franc, Merlot Malbec and Tannat) winery does not have a tasting room open to the public. Production is between 100 and 150 cases. Grapes are sold to the neighboring wineries. We produce a single red Bordeaux style blend (La Tour d'Afton 2008, 2009)for sale exclusively at Stinson Vineyards, in Crozet; shipping is available from their winery tasting room.

name: Twin Oaks Tavern Winery
description: "Top of the mountain to you!" In the early 1900's, Twin Oaks Tavern served as country inn where city people could relax in the cool breezes of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Today our winery and vineyard, located at 1150' altitude in the Bear's Den Historic District, offer breathtaking views and wines to match. Visit our beautiful tasting room and decks and enjoy views of the Shenandoah Valley and spectacular sunsets.Arrange for a tour of our vineyard and wine cellar. Kids and dogs are welcome. Visit www.twinoakstavernwinery.com for weekly and monthly Special Events and and check out Twin Oak Tavern's wine blog.

name: Two Twisted Posts Winery
description: A good wine is allowed to be itself and not Twisted to fit an image.  We focus on making a limited number of quality wines that are allowed to express the terroir of Loudoun Heights.  Come visit us now in our third year and grow with us over time.Our vineyard was established in 2008 and our first harvest in 2011. Our 2012 Chardonnay won a Gold Medal in the Virginia Governors Cups and was selected for the Governor's case. In 2017 we continue to win awards for our wines.Please come sit and drink some wine while you enjoy the view overlooking our vineyard.  Ask us about our vines or come out for a walking tour to see what we’re growing and what we do.  We love to talk about what we love.

name: Upper Shirley Vineyards
description: Upper Shirley Vineyards is located 20 miles southeast from the Capital in Richmond and 31 miles from Jamestown on the banks of the James River in Charles City County. Our waterfront view overlooks Turkey Island, home to the Presquile National Wildlife Refuge.Established in 2013, our estate grown grapes enjoy river breezes and the deep Pamunkey soil of the Tidewater region. Today we have 16 acres under vine and plans to expand. Our European varieties, vitis vinifera, were diligently selected to match our terroir and include:Petit Verdot, a Bordeaux red grape valued for its spice and tannin in a blending role, has now become a successful single varietal here in Virginia.Viognier, a Rhone Valley white grape, the official Virginia grape, has wonderful aromas of peach and pear.Merlot, another of the 5 Bordeaux red grapes, ripens early and is softer in tannin than its blending partners.Tannat, a lesser known Basque red grape, is now making some of the most impressive wines in Virginia.

name: Valerie Hill Vineyard & Winery
description: Valerie Hill Vineyard & Winery is a family owned and operated farm winery born from our commitment to preserve the rural beauty of the Commonwealth, our desire to build a legacy for future generations of our family, and our passion for Virginia wine.  Located just south of Winchester near Stephens City, Virginia, our 18 acre farm is steeped in history.  The focus of our winery is our Tasting House, a Federal style brick manor house dating back to 1807 and the namesake of our business - Valerie Hill.Valerie Hill was built in 1807 by Revolutionary War Captain Peter Rust.  She has been caringly restored and serves as the public centerpiece of the winery.  Many of her rooms are open to the public to enjoy wine tastings and light fare, surrounded by original heart pine floors and horsehair plaster walls.  One visit, and we're sure you will love Valerie Hill's quaint beauty just as much as we do.

name: Valhalla Vineyards
description: Valhalla Vineyards has been growing grapes and producing award winning estate wines from a 2000ft. mountaintop overlooking Roanoke Virginia since 1998.  Our 21 acre vineyard produces world class cabernet sauvignon, syrah, merlot, chardonnay, cab franc and more. Its decomposing granite soils and unique climate (similar to Rhone Valley of France) afford the premiere terrior on the East Coast.

name: Valley Road Vineyards
description: Located at the gateway to the Rockfish Valley on Route 151 in Albemarle County, Valley Road Vineyards opened its doors in July 2016. A purveyor of exquisite wines, the company was conceived by a group of friends who share a love for the Virginia grape. Located on 22 acres, the vineyard enjoys commanding Blue Ridge views, and is conveniently situated in the heart of the Monticello Viticultural Area for easy guest access. In addition to the Virginia Governor's Cup Gold Medal-winning 2014 Petit Verdot, Valley Road Vineyards offers ten other varietals and blends in its tasting room, “SIP”, which is open to the public six days a week. Groups welcome, $12 per person tasting fee.

name: Vault Field Vineyards
description: Welcome to Vault Field Vineyards, located on historic Vault Field Farm near the town of Kinsale, in the heart of Virginia's Northern Neck. Our award winning wines are the result of a marriage between an exceptional terroir and the latest techniques in viticulture. We, at Vault Field, believe fine wines are made in the vineyard.  The care of the vines is yearlong, starting with hand pruning during winter months.  Next comes hand weeding and continued pruning during the growing season. Finally, in late fall, when the grapes ripen, we hand pick and sort the individual grapes to produce high quality, premium wines. We hope you enjoy the fruits of our labor with family and friends.

name: Veramar Vineyard
description: Founded in 2000, Veramar Vineyard was one of the first successful wineries in the northern Shenandoah Valley. The vineyard is run by James and Della Bogaty, who were original members of the Shenandoah Valley Wine Trail. Justin, their son, is the winemaker. He is a graduate of VMI and has a certificate of oenology from UC Davis. Our wine is internationally-acclaimed, and is made at the foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains.Veramar Vineyard is located of Rt 7 in the northern Shenandoah Valley AVA of Virginia. Right over the Blue Ridge Mountains from Loudoun County, Veramar is a short drive from Leesburg or Winchester, and easily accessible from Washington, DC, Northern Virginia, Frederick, MD, Harpers Ferry, WV, and the Interstate 81 corridor.This hidden gem, nestled in the rolling hills near the Shenandoah River, has an expansive views of the mountains from the 28 acres of vineyards and the rustic yet elegant tasting room and terrace. In this idyllic setting we grow Cabernet Franc, Chardonnay, Seyval Blanc, Traminette, Norton, Albariño, Vidal Blanc and Malbec wine grapes, and make Virginian wine across a spectrum of varietals and blends. Each wine distinctively expresses our dedication to premium Virginia winemaking.The Bogaty family founded Veramar in 2000, when there were very few wineries operating successfully in this part of the state. Since then, the business has grown to include their son, Justin Bogaty, as winemaker, and there has certainly been a tremendous boom in the Virginian wine industry since then, especially in Loudoun County. But over the years we have never lost our values of family and sustainability - every aspect of Veramar, from the vineyard to the winemaking itself, is managed with the goal of creating a family business that can be passed down to many generations of Bogatys to come. We strive to be grounded enough to forego trends and fads in favor of the lasting principles that will sustain Veramar and Shenandoah Valley winemaking culture many years into the future.Our tasting room is open year-round, seven days a week, and opens daily at noon. The estate and vineyards are also the perfect setting for an elegant winery wedding or private party, a venue perfectly situated near Northern Virginia, Winchester, VA, and Washington, DC. We hope you'll visit us, and experience everything that premium Virginian wine has to offer!

name: Veritas Winery
description: Veritas Winery opened for business in June 2002 and has succeeded in consistently producing a range of complex and elegant wines. The idyllic setting is easy to find but hard to leave, located just off I-64 at the foot of the Blue Ridge Mountains.Veritas wines are all unique and of high quality, derived from vitis vinifera with the exception of one French hybrid. Our philosophy is to make wine with the classic, old-style principles of Viticulture and Vinification, at the same time using state of the art technology to capture varietal and regional character.

name: Villa Appalaccia
description: Enjoy a slice of Tuscany on the Blue Ridge Parkway in southwest Virginia. Taste our innovative wines made from Primitivo, Sangiovese, Malvasia, Aglianico, Corvina, Montepulciano and Cabernet Franc grapes. We are close to the arts and music of the town of Floyd. We are located beside the music venue, FLOYDFEST. There is no signage permitted on the Blueridge Parkway!

name: Village Winery
description: Our farm winery and vineyards opened summer of 2005. We are located outside the heart of the Historic Village of Waterford. The tasting and barrel room are housed in a restored farm structure adjoining our large, old bank barn. We offer Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Merlot Cabernet blend, Apple Wine, Raspberry & Apple,  Elderberry & Apple,  Elderberry & Raspberry & Apple,  Elderberry wine, Elderberry & Aronia Tea and Elderberry & Aronia Syrup.            Now Offering our Wines in 3 Liter Pouches for a Great Value

name: Vincent's Vineyard
description: Vincent's Vineyard is on the 14 acre Gilmer Farm with 3/1/2 acres of vines overlooking Big Cedar Creek and grazing sheep. The tasting room is open with free wine tastings and tours, wine accessories and gifts, and some good old fashion hospitality. Come and enjoy the beautiful scenery and experience the country setting at Vincent's Vineyard.

name: Vint Hill Craft Winery
description: There’s no other place like this -- the Washington DC Area's Only "Urban Winery" where we explore winemaking together and wine appreciation. Our Teaching & Tasting Bar overlooks the entire wine production area -- you can sample great wines while you watch every step in the winemaking process.And for those ready to learn even more, our Vintner program provides the opportunity for individuals and small groups to work side-by-side with us as they craft their own wine.  It’s "your" wine with the best Virginia, California or Washington State fruit; your design, your label and, of course your story and passion.Vint Hill Craft Winery is located in the historic barns at Vint Hill Farm Station, in the building where in 1944 our military intercepted the German encryption codes that started the end of World War II.  Great wine, lots to see and learn and deep in history!

name: Vintners Cellar Winery of Yorktown
description: Vintners Cellar Winery of Yorktown

name: Virginia Mountain Vineyards
description: During your visit to Virginia Mountain Vineyards you will  enjoy our 13 specially prepared wines for your palate's pleasure. Find the perfect one for you and relax in the gazebo or on the patio as you enjoy the picturesque mountain views and the serenity of the estate vines.  The winery is located 10.8 miles west of Exit 156 I-81, just off Rt. 220 outside the center of Historic Fincastle. "Come and Taste the difference."

name: Webster C Hall Vineyards
description: Coming soon!

name: Weston Farm Vineyard and Winery
description: Weston Farm Vineyard & Winery is located 1/2 mile south of the quaint town of Louisa.  Bobby & Penny Martin first planted 10 acres of vines in 2005 with their first crush in 2009.We currently offer Pinot Grigio, Petit Manseng, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon, Meritage, Petit Verdot, Norton, Norton Reserve, Rose', Watermelon, Raspberry, Peach, Strawberry and a Cherry port.Bring a picnic lunch, enjoy our wines, views of the vineyard, the resident French bulldog - Suzie resident foxhound "Weston", horses, and display of historical items found here at the farm.We also have a B&B on site.In our tasting room we offer gift items from local crafters as well as wine-related items, t-shirts and sweatshirts.

name: West Wind Farm Vineyard and Winery
description: West Wind Farm Vineyard Winery is located on a fourth-generation homestead in the Blue Ridge Mountains of Southwest Virginia. We're near the intersection of I81 and I77 in Wythe County. Join us to taste small batch, handcrafted Virginia wine.We have special events throughout the year (including our Summer Saturdays concerts), so please find us on Facebook or visit our website.West Wind Farm is also a great place to entertain. We love putting on events from simple to sublime. Inquire.

name: Whitebarrel Winery
description: Whitebarrel winery, previously known as Attimo Winery is located in Montgomery County, Virginia.  More about us:  Vineyard plantings began in 2007 and Attimo Winery completed its first harvest in the fall of 2010.  We are continually expanding the vineyard and have over 10 acres under vine.  Our hours of operation are Mon, Tues, Wed, Thurs from 11 am - 7 pm, Fri and Sat 11 am -  8 pm and Sunday from 12pm - 6pm. The winery will offer the following wines: Vidal, Chardonnay, blended white wine (whites), and, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet sauvignon, Chambourcin, and blended reds (reds). The winery will also produce mango-style, Apple-style, and blush winesFind us on Facebook and on Twitter

name: White Hall Vineyards
description: Located just 15 minutes from historic Charlottesville, we offer tours of our state-of-the-art winery and tastings of our award-winning wines.  We invite you to stop by and enjoy a glass of wine in front of our roaring fire in the winter or under the shade of our Oak trees in the spring and summer.  Our friendly tasting room staff will make you feel right at home in the foothills of the beautiful Blue Ridge Mountains.

name: White Rock Vineyards & Winery
description: Our family owned and operated vineyard and winery offers southern hospitality and a spectacular view from the tasting room and veranda. Convenient to tourist destinations of Smith Mountain Lake and the Blue Ridge Parkway and also to the metro areas of Roanoke and Lynchburg.  A picture perfect setting awaits your special event or gathering.

name: Wilderness Run Vineyards
description: Beautiful vistas of our vineyards, future vineyards, and orchard. Talk to the people involved from selection of vines to the uncorking of our first vintage. What was a dairy operation for the better part of the century our undulating hills are growing beautiful fruit on what could be the most historic vineyard sites in the country.

name: Williamsburg Winery
description: Located on the historic 300-acre Wessex Hundred farm, the Williamsburg Winery offers the opportunity to taste, dine, stay, and relax.  Three different tasting options are available.  Tours of the barrel cellar are offered daily.  An extensive tour with reserve and library wine tasting is also available by advance reservation.  Winemaker Matthew Meyer produces 25+ wines annually including the new Wessex Hundred series of estate grown wines.
